TEXT.English: The shipyard in %s2_city attracts harlots from the Old World.
TEXT.French: Верфь в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] привлекает проституток из Старого Света.
TEXT.German: Die Schiffswerft in %s2_city lockt Dirnen aus der Alten Welt an.
TEXT.Italian: The shipyard in %s2_city attracts harlots from the Old World.
TEXT.Spanish: The shipyard in %s2_city attracts harlots from the Old World.

TEXT.English: Governor, in %s2_city a skipper's widow opened up a brothel. She hired some young harlots from Europe to sweeten the sailors' evenings. Shall we expel these wanton women?
TEXT.French: Милорд, в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] решительная вдова капитана открыла бордель рядом с верфью и набрала несколько молодых шлюх из Европы, которые теперь услаждают вечера грузчиков. Должны ли мы изгнать этих распутных женщин?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, in %s2_city hat eine resolute Kapitänswitwe neben der Schiffswerft ein Bordell aufgemacht und ein paar junge Dirnen aus der Heimat angeworben, die nun den Zimmermännern und Schauerleuten den Feierabend versüßen. Sollen wir die Weibsbilder vertreiben?
TEXT.Italian: Governor, in %s2_city a skipper's widow opened up a brothel. She hired some young harlots from Europe to sweeten the sailors' evenings. Shall we expel these women?
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, in %s2_city a skipper's widow opened up a brothel. She hired some young harlots from Europe to sweeten the sailors' evenings. Shall we expel these women?

TEXT.English: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. Maybe it will make them more productive.
TEXT.French: Оставьте шлюх в покое. Они удовлетворяют наших рабочих. Возможно, это сделает их более продуктивными.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Freudenmädchen in Ruhe! Den Männern wird's die Laune heben, und fröhlich und frisch arbeitet's am besten.
TEXT.Italian: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. Maybe it will make them more productive.
TEXT.Spanish: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. Maybe it will make them more productive.

TEXT.English: Seize these whores and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.
TEXT.French: Схватить этих шлюх и отправить работать на поля! Если они и получат мозоли на руках, то только благодаря достойной работе.
TEXT.German: Sammelt die Huren ein und schickt sie zur Arbeit auf die Felder! Wenn sie schwielige Hände bekommen wollen, dann durch anständige Arbeit.
TEXT.Italian: Gather these hookers and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.
TEXT.Spanish: Gather these hookers and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.

TEXT.English: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Set each one of them in front of a loom!
TEXT.French: У этих блудниц наверняка ловкие пальцы. Отправьте их на конюшни заботиться о животных, там они смогут принести больше пользы.
TEXT.German: Diese Dirnen haben doch sicher geschickte Finger. Setzt sie an den Webstuhl, da können sie sich nützlicher machen. Und schickt mir hin und wieder eine mit einer Arbeitsprobe vorbei.
TEXT.Italian: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Get each one of them in front of a loom!
TEXT.Spanish: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Get each one of them in front of a loom!

TEXT.English: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.
TEXT.French: Какая жалость! Эти несчастные молодые души! Освободите их из борделя и отдайте в воскресную школу.
TEXT.German: Welch trauriges Los diese jungen Seelen doch haben! Befreit die Mädchen aus dem Bordell und steckt sie in die Sonntagsschule.
TEXT.Italian: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.
TEXT.Spanish: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.

TEXT.English: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!
TEXT.French: Заковать этих грешниц и отправить обратно в Европу! И провозгласите, что наша община здесь принимает новых членов только с истинной христианской верой!
TEXT.German: Legt diese sündigen Metzen in Ketten und schickt sie mit dem nächsten Handelssegler zurück in die Heimat. Und lasst dort verkünden, dass unsere Gemeinschaft hier nur Menschen mit tugendhaftem christlichen Gebaren aufnimmt.
TEXT.Italian: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!
TEXT.Spanish: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!

TEXT.English: A master shipwright offers his services in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Мастер-корабел предлагает свои услуги в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Ein Schiffsbaumeister bietet seine Dienste in %s2_city an.
TEXT.Italian: A master shipwright offers his services in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A master shipwright offers his services in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Governor, a master shipwright offers to enhance the cargo capacity of one of your ships in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] какой-то мастер-корабел говорит, что может улучшить корабль в нашей гавани. Благодаря разумному использованию пространства он хочет увеличить грузоподъемность. Давайте позволим ему это сделать?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, in %s2_city bietet Euch ein durchreisender Schiffsbaumeister an, in der Schiffswerft ein Schiff auszubauen. Durch geschickte Raumnutzung will er mehr Stauraum schaffen. Sollen wir ihn gewähren lassen?
TEXT.Italian: Governor, a master shipwright offers to enhance the cargo capacity of one of your ships in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, a master shipwright offers to enhance the cargo capacity of one of your ships in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]With a %d3% percentage of success the unit "%s2_unit" receives %d1 [NUM1:extra cargo space:extra cargo spaces].
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] получит %d1 [NUM1:дополнительный грузовой отсек:дополнительных грузовых отсека] (процент успеха %d3%).
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Mit %d3% Wahrscheinlichkeit, erhält die Einheit "%s2_unit" %d1 [NUM1:zusätzlichen Frachtraum:zusätzliche Frachträume].
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]With a %d3% percentage of success the unit "%s2_unit" receives %d1 [NUM1:extra cargo space:extra cargo spaces].
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]With a %d3% percentage of success the unit "%s2_unit" receives %d1 [NUM1:extra cargo space:extra cargo spaces].

TEXT.English: Let him do so. If he steals our time, tell the men to keelhaul him.
TEXT.French: Позвольте ему сделать это. Если он отнимет у нас время, прикажите провести его под килем.
TEXT.German: Lasst ihn gewähren. Wenn er unsere Zeit verschwendet, lasst ihn Kielholen!
TEXT.Italian: Let him do so. If he steals our time, tell the men to keelhaul him.
TEXT.Spanish: Let him do so. If he steals our time, tell the men to keelhaul him.

TEXT.English: Offer him every support he needs. I am sure he will be successful.
TEXT.French: Окажите ему любую поддержку, в которой он нуждается. Я уверен, что он добьется успеха.
TEXT.German: Gewährt ihm jegliche Unterstützung, die er benötigt. Ich bin sicher, er wird Erfolg haben!
TEXT.Italian: Offer him every support he needs. I am sure he will be successful.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer him every support he needs. I am sure he will be successful.

TEXT.English: Send him away. We need our ship right now.
TEXT.French: Гоните его прочь. Корабль нужен нам прямо сейчас.
TEXT.German: Schickt ihn weg, unser Schiff wird dringend anderweitig gebraucht!
TEXT.Italian: Send him away. We need our ship right now.
TEXT.Spanish: Send him away. We need our ship right now.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Governor, the impostor has fled with your money![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Милорд, мошенник скрылся с нашими деньгами![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Gouverneur, der Hochstapler hat sich mit Eurem Geld auf und davon gemacht![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Governor, the impostor has fled with your money![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Governor, the impostor has fled with your money![COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Governor, the cargo space upgrade of the %s1_unit is progressing quickly.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Милорд, расширение грузового отсека [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] идет полным ходом.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gouverneur, der Ausbau der %s1_unit schreitet zügig voran.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Governor, the cargo space upgrade of the %s1_unit is progressing quickly.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Governor, the cargo space upgrade of the %s1_unit is progressing quickly.[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Inspired by religious music and sculpture in %s2_city, a new Great Artist has emerged in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire.
TEXT.French: Вдохновленный религиозной музыкой и скульптурой в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT], в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] Империи появляется великий художник.
TEXT.German: Von den religiösen Klängen und Skulpturen in der Stadt %s2_city inspiriert, wurden im %s1:2_civ_adjective Reich neue Künstler ausgebildet.
TEXT.Italian: Nell'impero %s1_civ_adjective è emerso un nuovo Grande Artista, ispirato dalla musica e dalla scultura religiose a %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Inspirado por la música y las esculturas religiosas de %s2_city, ha aparecido un gran artista en el imperio %s1:1_civ_adjective.

TEXT.English: The music played in your %s5_building in %s2_city has inspired a young person, who has grown into a Great Artist!
TEXT.French: Музыка, играющая в вашем %s5_building в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT], вдохновила молодого исполнителя, который стал великим артистом!
TEXT.German: Die Musik, die in Eurer %s5_building in %s2_city gespielt wird, hat zahlreiche junge Menschen dazu inspiriert, sich zu Künstlern ausbilden zu lassen!
TEXT.Italian: La musica suonata in %s5_building a %s2_city ha ispirato un giovane, che è poi diventato un Grande Artista!
TEXT.Spanish: La música tocada en [NUM5:nuestro:nuestra:nuestros:nuestras] %s5_building de %s2_city ha inspirado a un joven, que ha crecido hasta convertirse en un gran artista.

TEXT.English: The art and sculpture decorating the %s5_building in %s2_city has nurtured the imagination and talents of a new Great Artist!
TEXT.French: Искусство и скульптуры, украшающие ваше %s5_building в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT], разожгли воображение и талант нового великого художника!
TEXT.German: Die in der %s5_building der Stadt %s2_city zu besichtigende Kunst und Bildhauerei hat der Vorstellungskraft und dem Talent neuer Künstler Vorschub geleistet!
TEXT.Italian: L'arte e la scultura che decorano %s5_building a %s2_city hanno nutrito l'immaginazione e i talenti di un nuovo Grande Artista!
TEXT.Spanish: El arte y las esculturas que decoran [NUM5:el:la:los:las] %s5_building de %s2_city ha alimentado la imaginación y el talento de un nuevo gran artista.

TEXT.English: Please grant an audience to this promising new artist so that we may decide how best to make use of their talents.
TEXT.French: Пожалуйста, предоставьте аудиенцию этому многообещающему новому артисту, чтобы мы могли решить, как лучше всего использовать его таланты.
TEXT.German: Gewährt den viel versprechenden neuen Künstlern eine Audienz, damit wir entscheiden können, wie wir ihre Talente am besten nutzen können.
TEXT.Italian: Accorda udienza a questo nuovo artista, in modo che possiamo decidere come meglio usare i suoi talenti.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se le conceda una audiencia a este prometedor nuevo artista para que podamos decidir cómo aprovechar mejor su talento.

TEXT.English: Constant attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to drive the harassers away.
TEXT.French: Из-за постоянных нападений на мирные торговые суда из Европы были отправлены фрегаты, чтобы выследить пиратов.
TEXT.German: Angriffe durch Kriegsschiffe beeinträchtigen die Überfahrten der Händler. Ein Monarch schickt eine Fregatte, um die Störenfriede zu vertreiben.
TEXT.Italian: Constant attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to drive the harassers away.
TEXT.Spanish: Constant attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to drive the harassers away.

TEXT.English: The ongoing attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to dispose of the harassers once and for all.
TEXT.French: После непрекращающихся атак на торговые суда из Европы прибывают фрегаты, чтобы уничтожить хищников раз и навсегда.
TEXT.German: Immer noch beeinträchtigen Kriegsschiffe die Überfahrten der Händler. Ein Monarch schickt eine Fregatte, um den Störenfrieden den Garaus zu machen.
TEXT.Italian: The ongoing attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to dispose of the harassers once and for all.
TEXT.Spanish: The ongoing attacks on peaceful merchant ships result in fregates being sent from Europe to dispose of the harassers once and for all.

TEXT.English: Warships and pirates are still terrorizing the merchants. A King in Europe is going out of his way to send a third fregate to America to protect the sea lanes.
TEXT.French: Каперы и пираты все еще терроризируют купцов. Короли Европы отправляют в Америку третий фрегат для защиты морских путей.
TEXT.German: Kriegsschiffe terrorisieren ohne Unterlass die Überfahrten der Händler. Ein Monarch scheut weder Kosten noch Mühen und schickt zum dritten Mal eine Fregatte nach Amerika, um die Küste sicherer zu machen.
TEXT.Italian: Warships and pirates are still terrorizing the merchants. A King in Europe is going out of his way to send a third fregate to America to protect the sea lanes.
TEXT.Spanish: Warships and pirates are still terrorizing the merchants. A King in Europe is going out of his way to send a third fregate to America to protect the sea lanes.

TEXT.English: Governor, hostile ships are hunting our merchants. Our King will send a frigate to fight against pirates.
TEXT.French: Милорд, вражеские корабли охотятся на наших торговцев. Фрегат нашего Короля отправит их на дно.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, Kriegsschiffe fremder Nationen machen unsere Küste unsicher. Unser König wird eine Fregatte entsenden, um den Halunken ein nasses Grab zu bereiten.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, hostile ships are hunting our merchants. Our King will send a frigate to fight against pirates.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, hostile ships are hunting our merchants. Our King will send a frigate to fight against pirates.

TEXT.English: Governor, hostile ships are still on patrol along our coast and are capturing our merchant ships. Our King will send another frigate to protect the sea lanes.
TEXT.French: Милорд, вражеские корабли все еще охотятся у нашего побережья, захватывая наши торговые суда. Наш Король отправит еще один фрегат для защиты морских путей.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, immer noch segeln Feinde an unserer Küste entlang und machen Jagd auf unsere Schiffe. Unser König entsendet erneut eine Fregatte zu unserem Schutz.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, hostile ships are still on patrol along our coast and are capturing our merchant ships. Our King will send another frigate to protect the sea lanes.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, hostile ships are still on patrol along our coast and are capturing our merchant ships. Our King will send another frigate to protect the sea lanes.

TEXT.English: Governor, our King is deeply disappointed about your inability to keep the sea lanes safe. He has sent again a frigate from Europe to support us. Rest assured, this will be the last help he is giving us.
TEXT.French: Милорд, Король разочарован нашей неспособностью разобраться с вражескими кораблями. Он в очередной раз приказал отправить фрегат из Европы в Новый Свет, чтобы уничтожить этих негодяев. Однако, Король предупреждает нас, что больше кораблей он выделить не сможет.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, unser König lässt verlauten, er sei enttäuscht von unserem Unvermögen, die feindlichen Kriegsschiffe zur Räson zu ziehen. Er hat erneut eine Fregatte aus Europa in die Neue Welt abkommandiert, um diese Schurken auszuschalten. Der König warnt uns aber - weitere Schiffe könne er nicht entbehren.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, our King is deeply disappointed about your inability to keep the sea lanes safe. He has sent again a frigate from Europe to support us. Rest assured, this will be the last help he is giving us.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, our King is deeply disappointed about your inability to keep the sea lanes safe. He has sent again a frigate from Europe to support us. Rest assured, this will be the last help he is giving us.

TEXT.English: Splendid! Send our majesty a letter of thanks.
TEXT.French: Великолепно! Пошлите Его Величеству благодарственное письмо.
TEXT.German: Famos! Lasst uns dem König ein Dankschreiben schicken.
TEXT.Italian: Splendid! Send our majesty a letter of thanks.
TEXT.Spanish: Splendid! Send our majesty a letter of thanks.

TEXT.English: Excellent! This ship may really help us.
TEXT.French: Отлично! Этот корабль действительно может нам помочь.
TEXT.German: Vortrefflich! Das könnte uns wahrlich helfen.
TEXT.Italian: Excellent! This ship may really help us.
TEXT.Spanish: Excellent! This ship may really help us.

TEXT.English: We owe our majesty a debt of gratitude for his support so far. And if he thinks we should learn to stand on our own feet, he will notice soon that we plan to do exactly that ...
TEXT.French: Мы в большом долгу перед Его Величеством за поддержку. И если он считает, что мы должны научиться стоять на собственных ногах, то скоро заметит, что мы планируем сделать именно это...
TEXT.German: Wir schulden dem König Dank für seine bisherige Unterstützung. Und wenn er der Meinung ist, wir sollten lernen, auf eigenen Füßen zu stehen, dann wird er bald merken, dass wir genau dies vorhaben ...
TEXT.Italian: We owe our majesty a debt of gratitude for his support so far. And if he thinks we should learn to stand on our own feet, he will notice soon that we plan to do exactly that ...
TEXT.Spanish: We owe our majesty a debt of gratitude for his support so far. And if he thinks we should learn to stand on our own feet, he will notice soon that we plan to do exactly that ...

TEXT.English: A tobacco plantation is in danger.
TEXT.French: Разгневанные женщины угрожают плантации табака.
TEXT.German: Tabakpflanzern wird von renitenten Frauenzimmern Feuer unterm Hintern gemacht.
TEXT.Italian: A tobacco plantation is in danger.
TEXT.Spanish: A tobacco plantation is in danger.

TEXT.English: A group of angry women want to destroy our tobacco plantation outside %s2_city. The say that smoking is sinful.
TEXT.French: Милорд, разгневанные женщины идут на табачную плантацию за пределами [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT]. Они несут факелы и хотят предать её огню. Их предводительница заявляет, что вдыхать дым — сатанинское дело. Всякий, кто курит сигару, служит дьяволу.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, aufgebrachte Weibsbilder marschieren in %s2_city zu einer Tabakplantage. Sie tragen Fackeln und wollen das Anwesen niederbrennen. Ihre Anführerin hält flammende Reden, das Einatmen von Qualm sei satanisch. Wer eine Zigarre paffe, würde dem Teufel ein Brandopfer bringen.
TEXT.Italian: A group of angry ladies want to destroy our tobacco plantation outside %s2_city. The say that smoking is sinful.
TEXT.Spanish: A group of angry ladies want to destroy our tobacco plantation outside %s2_city. The say that smoking is sinful.

TEXT.English: Our ladies won't become arsonists. Ignore them.
TEXT.French: Наши дамы не станут поджигательницами. Не обращайте на них внимания.
TEXT.German: Viel Rauch um nichts! Unsere Damen sind zu tugendhaft, um zu Brandstifterinnen zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Our ladies won't become aronists. Ignore them.
TEXT.Spanish: Our ladies won't become aronists. Ignore them.

TEXT.English: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!
TEXT.French: Отнесите письмо их предводительнице. Она получит причудливую шляпу со страусиными перьями, если к завтрашнему дню этот бунт закончится!
TEXT.German: Bringt der Rädelsführerin eine Botschaft. Wenn sie die anderen Frauenzimmer zum Einlenken bewegen kann, lasse ich ihr aus Europa einen sündhaft schönen Hut mit Straußenfedern schicken.
TEXT.Italian: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!
TEXT.Spanish: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!

TEXT.English: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back to terms!
TEXT.French: У наших дам вспыльчивый характер. Отправьте солдат, чтобы привести их в чувство!
TEXT.German: Das klingt brandgefährlich. Lasst Truppen ausrücken, sie sollen die Weiber zur Raison bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back to terms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back to terms!

TEXT.English: Boll weevils are troubling farmers.
TEXT.French: Долгоносики уничтожают посевы хлопка.
TEXT.German: Rüsselkäfer und ihre Larven plagen eine Baumwollplantage.
TEXT.Italian: Boll weevils are troubling farmers.
TEXT.Spanish: Boll weevils are troubling farmers.

TEXT.English: Boll weevils are troubling the farmers of our plantation outside %s2_city. Governor, what shall we do?
TEXT.French: Милорд, долгоносики заполонили плантацию возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT]. Черный жук вгрызается в хлопковую коробочку и откладывает туда яйца. Личинки съедают все, что находится в капсулах, прежде чем мы успеваем собрать хлопковые нити. Шаман индейцев советует нам уничтожить поля и сжечь плантацию. В противном случае заражение будет распространяться.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, Baumwollkapselkäfer haben eine Plantage bei %s2_city befallen. Das schwarze Getier bohrt seine Rüssel in die Kapselfrüchte und legt dort Eier ab. Larven fresssen die Kapseln leer, bevor wir ihre Samenfäden ernten können. Ein indianischer Medizinmann hat uns geraten, die Felder zu vernichten und sogar das Anwesen niederzubrennen, anderenfalls sei der Plage nicht Herr zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Boll weevils are troubling the farmers of our plantation outside %s2_city. Governor, what shall we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Boll weevils are troubling the farmers of our plantation outside %s2_city. Governor, what shall we do?

TEXT.English: Destroy the plants, the buildings, destroy all of them.
TEXT.French: Уничтожьте растения, здания, уничтожьте их всех.
TEXT.German: Fackelt nicht lange. Fackelt alles ab!
TEXT.Italian: Destroy the plants, the buildings, destroy all of them.
TEXT.Spanish: Destroy the plants, the buildings, destroy all of them.

TEXT.English: Recruit some tramps and set them to exterminate the bugs.
TEXT.French: Наймите несколько бродяг и отправьте их уничтожать жуков.
TEXT.German: Versprecht jedem Landstreicher einen Beutel Münzen, der in unsere Dienste tritt und hilft, die Käfer von den Pflanzen zu klauben.
TEXT.Italian: Recruit some tramps, they have to catch the bugs.
TEXT.Spanish: Recruit some tramps, they have to catch the bugs.

TEXT.English: Visit the natives and buy a poison to kill the bugs.
TEXT.French: Посетите туземцев и купите яд, чтобы убить жуков.
TEXT.German: Ich wette, dieser Schamane kennt ein Gift, das die Schädlinge vertreibt. Kauft ihm die Rezeptur ab.
TEXT.Italian: Visit the natives and buy a poison to kill the bugs.
TEXT.Spanish: Visit the natives and buy a poison to kill the bugs.

TEXT.English: You have built your first church in the New World. However, godliness does not need false modesty.
TEXT.French: Вы построили свою первую церковь в Новом Свете и таким образом совершили благочестивое дело. Однако благочестие не любит ложной скромности.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt Eure erste Kirche in der Neuen Welt erbaut und damit ein frommes Werk getan. Doch Gottesfurcht kennt weder Maß noch Bescheidenheit.
TEXT.Italian: You have built your first church in the New World. However, godliness does not need false modesty.
TEXT.Spanish: You have built your first church in the New World. However, godliness does not need false modesty.

TEXT.English: Be the first governor to build five abbeys. The Lord will be grateful and our king will surely have an earthly reward as well.
TEXT.French: Ñòàíüòå ïåðâûì ãóáåðíàòîðîì ïîñòðîèâøèì ïÿòü ìîíàñòûðåé. Ãîñïîäü áëàãîñëàâèò âàñ íà íåáå, à êîðîëü, íåñîìíåííî, âîçíàãðàäèò íà çåìëå.
TEXT.German: Errichtet als erster Gouverneur fünf Abteien in dieser heidnischen Wildnis. Nicht nur Euer himmlischer Herrscher wird Euch dies danken, sondern auch Euer weltlicher daheim - eine große Belohnung ist Euch gewiss.
TEXT.Italian: Be the first governor to build five abbeys. The Lord will be grateful and our king will surely have an earthly reward as well.
TEXT.Spanish: Be the first governor to build five abbeys. The Lord will be grateful and our king will surely have an earthly reward as well.

TEXT.English: For God's sake! Another governor has built five abbeys before we were able to. Forget about any rewards.
TEXT.French: Господи, ну как так-то?! Другой губернатор построил пять аббатств раньше, чем мы. Забудьте о каких-либо наградах...
TEXT.German: Schlechte Kunde! Ein anderer Gouverneur hat als erster fünf Abteien gebaut. Rechnet nicht mehr mit einer Belohnung, wenn Ihr ihm nacheifert.
TEXT.Italian: For God's sake! Another governor has built five abbeys before we were able to. Forget about any rewards.
TEXT.Spanish: For God's sake! Another governor has built five abbeys before we were able to. Forget about any rewards.

TEXT.English: Somebody has built five abbeys.
TEXT.French: Кто-то построил пять аббатств.
TEXT.German: Eine Nation hat fünf christliche Abteien errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Somebody has built five abbeys.
TEXT.Spanish: Somebody has built five abbeys.

TEXT.English: Congratulations! You are the first governor with five abbeys in the New World. The Lord's blessing will be upon you. Your King is also in a generous mood today.
TEXT.French: Поздравляю, Милорд! Вы первый губернатор с пятью аббатствами в Новом Свете. Да снизойдёт на вас Благословение Господа. Его Величество сегодня в прекрасном настроении после это новости.
TEXT.German: Glückwunsch! Ihr habt als erster Gouverneur fünf Abteien in der Neuen Welt errichtet. Gottes Lohn ist Euch gewiss. Aber auch Euer König möchte sich großzügig zeigen.
TEXT.Italian: Congratulations! You are the first governor with five abbayes in the New World. The Lord's blessing will be upon you. Your king is also in a generous mood.
TEXT.Spanish: Congratulations! You are the first governor with five abbayes in the New World. The Lord's blessing will be upon you. Your king is also in a generous mood.

TEXT.English: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.
TEXT.French: Наполняйте казну колоний, Ваше Величество, а мы и дальше будем творить добрые дела.
TEXT.German: Füllt die Schatzkammern unserer Kolonien, Hoheit, und wir werden weitere gute Werke vollbringen können.
TEXT.Italian: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.
TEXT.Spanish: Fill the coffers of the colonies, your Highness, and we will do further good deeds.

TEXT.English: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers?
TEXT.French: Что толку в наших соборах, если у нас нет опытных проповедников?
TEXT.German: Was nutzen die schönsten Kathedralen, wenn dort niemand auf der Kanzel steht und das Wort Gottes verkündet?
TEXT.Italian: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers for our new cathedrals?
TEXT.Spanish: What good are our cathedrals if we have no experienced preachers for our new cathedrals?

TEXT.English: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.
TEXT.French: Мы ожидаем много паломников. Пожалуйста, помогите нам гарантировать их безопасный проход.
TEXT.German: Sicher werden Wallfahrer aus aller Welt anreisen wollen. Bitte helft ihnen bei der Überfahrt.
TEXT.Italian: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.
TEXT.Spanish: We are expecting many pilgrims. Please help us to guarantee their safe passage.

TEXT.English: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.
TEXT.French: Вы хотите помочь нам, Ваше Величество? Что ж, возможно, в таком случае и мы сможем вам помочь. Опустошите свои тюрьмы и отправьте всю эту шушеру в колонии. Мы научим их благочестию и респектабельности. Ora et labora!
TEXT.German: Ihr wollt uns helfen, Majestät? Nun, vielleicht können wir Euch helfen. Leert Eure Arbeitshäuser und expediert das Gesindel in die Kolonien. Wir werden ihm Frömmigkeit und Ehrbarkeit einbläuen. Ora et labora!
TEXT.Italian: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.
TEXT.Spanish: Send us some criminals. We will teach them to be pious and hard-working.

TEXT.English: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?
TEXT.French: Жизнь в колониях тяжела и сделала людей бессердечными. Многие грубияны ворчат, что пышность молельных домов — пустая трата времени, а каждый священник — тунеядец. Пришлите нам крепких парней, чтобы научить этих еретиков набожности!
TEXT.German: Das Leben in den Kolonien ist beschwerlich und hat viele kaltherzig werden lassen. So mancher raue Gesell murrt, der Prunk der Gotteshäuser sei Verschwendung und jeder Pfaffe ein Schmarotzer. Schickt uns ein paar harte Burschen, um diesen Ketzern Frömmigkeit einzubleuen!
TEXT.Italian: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?
TEXT.Spanish: We have too many heretics. Could you send us some soldiers to teach these guys to be decent?

TEXT.English: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?
TEXT.French: Делегация от гильдий ремесленников к Губернатору. Мастера хвалят ваши усилия по созданию кузнечного цеха для массового производства скобяных изделий. Спрос на гвозди и заклепки, болты и оси, струбцины и винты растет. Производительность означает больший прогресс в колониях. Они предлагают построить фабрику, больше, чем когда-либо видел Новый Свет.
TEXT.German: Eine Abordnung der Handwerkergilden wird bei Euch vorstellig. Die Meister loben Eure Tatkraft, eine Schmiedemanufaktur errichtet zu haben, in der Eisenwaren in großen Mengen hergestellt werden können. Doch wüchse die Nachfrage an Nägeln und Nieten, Bolzen und Beilen, Schellen und Schrauben noch weiter an. Die Entwicklung der Kolonien hinge maßgeblich davon ab, diesen Bedarf zu decken. Demütig unterbreitet man Euch die Idee, an zentraler Stelle eine Fabrik zu errichten, größer als alle anderen, die die Neue Welt bisher gesehen hat.
TEXT.Italian: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?
TEXT.Spanish: You have built your first ironworks. Fine! But is that enough?

TEXT.English: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.French: Ïîñòðîéòå áîëüøîé èíñòðóìåíòàëüíûé çàâîä. Âàøè ãîðîæàíå áóäóò ïðèçíàòåëüíû.
TEXT.German: Eine Vision nach meinem Geschmack! Wohlan, ich werde diese Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichten lassen, als erste Produktionsstätte dieser Art in Amerika. Natürlich erwarte ich, dass die Handwerkerschaft dieses Engagement honorieren wird ...
TEXT.Italian: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.

TEXT.English: Oh no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!
TEXT.French: Другой губернатор первым построил завод инструментов. Можете не рассчитывать ни на какие награды, даже если построите свой.
TEXT.German: Ein anderer Gouverneur hat als erster eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichtet. Rechnet nicht mehr mit einer Belohnung, wenn Ihr gleichzieht.
TEXT.Italian: O no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!
TEXT.Spanish: O no! Another governor has built a great tool factory. Forget your gratification!

TEXT.English: Somebody has built a great tool factory.
TEXT.French: Кто-то построил отличный завод по производству инструментов.
TEXT.German: Eine Nation hat eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Somebody has built a great tool factory.
TEXT.Spanish: Somebody has built a great tool factory.

TEXT.English: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.
TEXT.French: Какое удивительное достижение! Вы были первым губернатором, построившим в Новом Свете завод инструментов. Ремесленные гильдии чувствуют себя в долгу перед вами.
TEXT.German: Welch erstaunliche Leistung! Ihr habt als erster Gouverneur eine Große Eisenwarenfabrik in der Neuen Welt errichtet. Die Handwerkergilden fühlen sich Euch zu Dank verpflichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Congratulations! You are the first governor with a great tool factory. Your citizens are grateful.

TEXT.English: Cash is king ...
TEXT.French: Наличные решают...
TEXT.German: Nur Bares ist Wahres ...
TEXT.Italian: Cash is king ...
TEXT.Spanish: Cash is king ...

TEXT.English: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guildmasters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.French: Вы не должны благодарить меня - я благодарю граждан! За возможность служить нашему сообществу в качестве государственного деятеля. Я уверен, что лидеры гильдий вдохновлены таким же патриотическим духом!
TEXT.German: Man muss mir nicht danken - ich danke der Bürgerschaft! Dafür, dass ich als Staatsmann unserem Gemeinwesen dienen darf. Ich bin mir sicher, dass die Gildenführer derselbe patriotische Geist beflügelt!
TEXT.Italian: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.Spanish: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.

TEXT.English: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.French: Теперь пришло время наполнить большой заводской зал жизнью. Главы гильдий должны поощрять своих самых способных сыновей заниматься кузнечным ремеслом!
TEXT.German: Jetzt gilt es, die große Fabrikhalle mit Leben zu füllen. Die Zunftmeister sollen ihre tüchtigsten Söhne fürs Schmiedehandwerk zur Verfügung stellen!
TEXT.Italian: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.Spanish: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.

TEXT.English: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.French: Этот завод не только будет поддерживать нашу гражданскую экономику, но и увеличит производство товаров, необходимых для военных действий. Пусть рабочие исполняют свой долг у станков! Мир увидит, что мы, может, и молодая нация, но хорошо защищены.
TEXT.German: Diese Fabrik wird nicht nur unsere zivile Wirtschaft zum Brummen bringen, sondern auch die Fertigung kriegswichtiger Güter ankurbeln. Lasst die Arbeiter in Uniform an den Werkbänken ihren Dienst verrichten! Die Welt soll wissen, dass wir eine wehrhafte junge Nation sind.
TEXT.Italian: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!

TEXT.English: A foreign emissary from the Russian court has arrived at your capitol.
TEXT.French: Милорд, на церемонии открытия вашего арсенала вас отводит в сторону странно одетый иностранец. Он говорит на вашем языке, но с жутким акцентом. Этот человек утверждает, что действует от имени русского князя, который хотел бы вести дела с сильнейшей экономической державой Нового Света.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, beim Richtfest Eures Arsenals zieht Euch ein fremdartig gekleideter Ausländer beiseite. Er spricht Eure Muttersprache, doch mit einem fürchterlichen Akzent. Der Mann behauptet, im Auftrag eines russischen Fürsten zu handeln, der gerne mit der stärksten Wirtschaftsmacht der Neuen Welt ins Geschäft kommen möchte.
TEXT.Italian: A foreign businessman is visiting your colonies. He says that he is a transactor of a Russian sovereign.
TEXT.Spanish: A foreign businessman is visiting your colonies. He says that he is a transactor of a Russian sovereign.

TEXT.English: The emissary promises you a deal of great advantage if your nation will be the first to build a great arsenal in the New World.
TEXT.French: Ïîñîë îáåùàåò âàì òåñíîå è âûãîäíîå ñîòðóäíè÷åñòâî, åñëè âàø íàðîä ïåðâûì ïîñòðîèò áîëüøîé àðñåíàë â Íîâîì Ñâåòå.
TEXT.German: Falls Eure Kolonie die erste sei, die in Amerika ein Großes Zeughaus errichte, könne Euch ein interessantes Geschäft vermittelt werden, kündigt der Unterhändler an. Zum Richtfest des Großen Zeughauses komme er wieder, und es sei ratsam, dann etwas Gold zur Verfügung zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.
TEXT.Spanish: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.

TEXT.English: Another governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessman will give the promised rewards to him.
TEXT.French: Другой губернатор первым построил большой арсенал и заключил сделку с русским князем. Вот чёрт!
TEXT.German: Ein anderer Gouverneur hat als erster ein Großes Zeughaus errichtet und das Geschäft mit dem russischen Fürsten abschließen können. Schade!
TEXT.Italian: Another American governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessmen will give the promised gratification to him.
TEXT.Spanish: Another American governor has built a great arsenal. The foreign businessmen will give the promised gratification to him.

TEXT.English: Somebody has built a great arsenal.
TEXT.French: Кто-то построил большой арсенал.
TEXT.German: Eine Nation hat ein Großes Zeughaus errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Somebody has built a great arsenal.
TEXT.Spanish: Somebody has built a great arsenal.

TEXT.English: Governor, you are the first to build a great arsenal. A foreign emissary from the court of the great Tsar of All the Russias offers you an interesting deal..
TEXT.French: Милорд, вы первый губернатор в Новом Свете, построивший Большой Арсенал. На церемонии открытия снова появляется зловещий иностранный бизнесмен, который утверждает, что действует от имени русского князя. Переговорщик до сих пор говорит на вашем языке с ужасным акцентом. Вы берете на себя смелость порекомендовать репетитора ваших племянников, мистера Берлитца, который предлагает отличное языковое образование. Однако сначала вы просите незнакомца представить предложение князя.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, Ihr habt als erster in der Neuen Welt ein Großes Zeughaus errichten können. Wie versprochen, taucht zum Richtfest der ominöse ausländische Geschäftsmann wieder auf, der vorgibt, im Auftrag eines russischen Fürsten zu handeln. Immer noch spricht der Unterhändler Eure Muttersprache mit furchtbarem Akzent. Ihr nehmt Euch vor, ihm den Hauslehrer Eurer Neffen, Herrn Berlitz, zu empfehlen, der bei der Spracherziehung der Tunichtgute wahre Wunder wirkte. Doch zuvor bittet Ihr den Fremden, die Angebote des Fürsten vorzutragen.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, you are the first one who manages to build a great arsenal. The foreign businessman, speaking for a Russian sovereign, offers you an interesting deal.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, you are the first one who manages to build a great arsenal. The foreign businessman, speaking for a Russian sovereign, offers you an interesting deal.

TEXT.English: Competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.French: Посредник предлагает вам двух талантливых оружейников из Санкт-Петербурга, желающих приехать в Новый Свет. Великолепно!
TEXT.German: Zwei meisterhafte Waffenschmiede aus Sankt Petersburg können in die Neue Welt kommen, bietet Euch der Unterhändler an. Famos!
TEXT.Italian: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.

TEXT.English: Soon the Russian sovereign is to marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of certain young valets and assure their discretion.
TEXT.French: Прусский князь собирается жениться на дочери русского царя. Прежде всего, он хотел бы незаметно избавиться от нескольких молодых камердинеров, чье доверие ему больше не нужно.
TEXT.German: Der russische Fürst heiratet in Bälde die Tochter des preußischen Königs. Vorab würde er gerne diskret einige junge Kammerdiener loswerden, deren Zutraulichkeiten jetzt nicht mehr erwünscht sind. Nun denn!
TEXT.Italian: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.
TEXT.Spanish: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.

TEXT.English: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awe-inspiring.
TEXT.French: Русский князь мог бы через своих посланников при европейских дворах разнести слух о твоем внушительном арсенале, что он почти равен московскому. Это звучит лестно!
TEXT.German: Der Fürst könne über seine Gesandten an den europäischen Höfen die Kunde verbreiten lassen, wie beeindruckend Euer Zeughaus sei und dass es selbst dem in Moskau fast gleichkomme. Das klingt schmeichelhaft!
TEXT.Italian: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.
TEXT.Spanish: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.

TEXT.English: This man seems to be a common hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change him into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.French: Чем дольше говорит посредник, тем более непродуманными звучат его предложения. Ваше сердце подсказывает вам, что этот человек — мошенник! Приказать гвардейцам схватить его, кошель с золотом отправить казначею, а этого проходимца отправить на работы.
TEXT.German: Je länger der Unterhändler redet, desto halbseidener klingen seine Offerten. Euer Herz sagt Euch, dass dieser Mann ein Nepper ist, ein Schlepper, ein Bauernfänger! Ihr heißt Eure Gardisten, dem Gauner die Geldbörse abzunehmen und ihn zu hartem, aber ehrlichen Tagewerk zu zwingen.
TEXT.Italian: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.Spanish: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.
TEXT.French: Склад в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] подвергся налету.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde überfallen.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of looting a cartload of rum.
TEXT.French: Склад в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] подвергся налету. Наши соседи [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ[COLOR_REVERT] из [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s6_city[COLOR_REVERT] подозреваются в краже тележки рома.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde überfallen und ausgeraubt. Unsere %s1_civ Nachbarn in %s6_city werden verdächtigt, den Überfall begangen und die Ladung Rum geraubt zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of the raid and looting a cartload of rum.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been raided. Our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of the raid and looting a cartload of rum.

TEXT.English: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.French: Чёрт возьми! Никогда не видел, чтобы исчезало так много рома! Ром пусть себе оставят, уровень алкоголизма в нашей колонии меня и так уже беспокоил... Но, Чёрт возьми!
TEXT.German: Potzblitz! Solche Schnapsnasen sind mir lange nicht mehr untergekommen. Lasst ihnen den Rum, es wurde sowieso Zeit gegen die Trunkenheit in unserer Kolonie vorzugehen.
TEXT.Italian: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.

TEXT.English: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running low on rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.French: Наши докеры и моряки поднимут бунт, если у них кончится ром. Остановите их! К оружию!
TEXT.German: Die Werftarbeiter und Matrosen werden meutern, wenn der Schnaps ausgeht. Haltet sie auf! Zu den Waffen, Männer!
TEXT.Italian: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!

TEXT.English: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.French: Украли только ром? Никто не пострадал? Отлично, отправьте им еще рома. От этого будет только лучше.
TEXT.German: Sie haben nur den Rum gestohlen? Niemand wurde verletzt? Schickt ihnen noch eine zusätzliche Ladung, das wird sich noch für uns auszahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.Spanish: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.

TEXT.English: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.French: Наши соседи [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ[COLOR_REVERT] выражают признательность за доставку рома.
TEXT.German: Unsere %s1_civ Nachbarn zeigen sich erkenntlich für den Rum.
TEXT.Italian: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.Spanish: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.

TEXT.English: Governor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.
TEXT.French: Милорд, руины возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] так и не были исследованы должным образом. Советники рекомендуют отправить туда экспедицию.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, die Ruinen nahe %s2_city sind bis heute nicht gründlich untersucht worden. Eure Berater empfehlen eine Expedition zu entsenden.
TEXT.Italian: Gouvernor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.
TEXT.Spanish: Gouvernor, the ruins near %s2_city were never explored properly. Your councillors recommend to send an expedition.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Экспедиция [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] отправляется к руинам возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Eine %s1:3_civ_adjective Expedition bricht in die Ruinen nahe %s2_city auf.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective expedition starts for the ruins near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without one!
TEXT.French: Пришлите наших самых опытных разведчиков! Их ждет богатство и слава, если они сделают ценное открытие. И поверьте, без него им лучше не возвращаться!
TEXT.German: Schickt unsere erfahrensten Späher! Reichtum und Ehre erwartet die Männer, wenn sie wertvolle Entdeckungen machen. Und glaubt mir, sie sollten besser nicht ohne eine Entdeckung zurückkommen!
TEXT.Italian: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!
TEXT.Spanish: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!

TEXT.English: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.
TEXT.French: Отправьте [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] для осмотра руин возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] в течение %d3 ходов.
TEXT.German: Schickt innerhalb von %d3 Runden eine Einheit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] in die Ruine nahe %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.
TEXT.Spanish: Send a unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1:1_unit[COLOR_REVERT] into the ruins near %s2_city within %d3 rounds.

TEXT.English: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.
TEXT.French: К сожалению, ваша экспедиция уже не может исследовать руины.
TEXT.German: Leider kann die Ruine von Eurer Expedition nicht mehr erkundet werden.
TEXT.Italian: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.
TEXT.Spanish: Unfortunately, your expedition can no longer explore the ruins.

TEXT.English: Governor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?
TEXT.French: Милорд, наша экспедиция прибыла к руинам. Что будем искать?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, unsere Expedition hat die Ruinen erreicht. Wonach sollen unsere Männer suchen?
TEXT.Italian: Gouvernor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?
TEXT.Spanish: Gouvernor, our expedition arrived at the ruins. What should our men focus on?

TEXT.English: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.French: Исследователи Королевского двора ожидают больше информации о дикарях нашего региона. Пусть люди ищут наследие туземцев! Наших исследователей особенно интересует таинственная узелковая письменность.
TEXT.German: Bei Hofe erwartet man sich weitere Erkenntnisse über die Wilden. Lasst nach ihren Hinterlassenschaften suchen! Insbesondere die geheimnisvolle Knotenschrift hat es unseren Forschern angetan.
TEXT.Italian: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.Spanish: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.

TEXT.English: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.French: Пусть они обыщут этот хлам. Может и найдут что-нибудь полезное.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie die Schrotthaufen nach etwas Verwertbarem durchsuchen.
TEXT.Italian: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.

TEXT.English: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.French: Мой дворец нуждается в ремонте. Пусть ищут сокровища!
TEXT.German: Mein Palast müsste dringend renoviert werden. Lasst sie nach Schätzen suchen!
TEXT.Italian: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.Spanish: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!

TEXT.English: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Успешная экспедиция [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] возвращается из руин возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die %s1:3_civ_adjective Expedition kehrt erfolgreich aus den Ruinen nahe %s2_city zurück!
TEXT.Italian: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] мастер-плотник хочет привезти свою семью из Европы.
TEXT.German: Ein %s1:4_civ_adjective Meisterzimmermann möchte seine Familie in die Neue Welt nachkommen lassen.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective master carpenter wishes to be visited by his family from Europe.

TEXT.English: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.
TEXT.French: Мастер-плотник хочет послать письмо своей семье в Европу, чтобы рассказать им все о прекрасном Новом Свете. Милорд, он спрашивает вас, не могли бы вы дать ему денег на оплату проезда одного из его братьев.
TEXT.German: Ein Meisterzimmermann will seiner Familie in der Heimat schreiben, wie sehr ihm das Leben in der Neuen Welt gefällt. Er fragt Euch, Herr Gouverneur, ob Ihr ihm etwas Geld geben möchtet. Er würde es seinen Angehörigen schicken, damit einer seiner Brüder in die Neue Welt nachkommen kann.
TEXT.Italian: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.
TEXT.Spanish: A master carpenter wishes to send a letter to his family in Europe and to tell them how pretty the New World is. Governor, he asks you whether you could give him some money for the passage of one of his brothers.

TEXT.English: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.
TEXT.French: Конечно! Его старший брат, кузнец, нам тоже пригодится.
TEXT.German: Aber sicher doch! Sein älterer Bruder, der Schmied, wäre hier gerne gesehen.
TEXT.Italian: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.
TEXT.Spanish: Sure! His eldest brother, the blacksmith, is welcome.

TEXT.English: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.
TEXT.French: Возможно, его младший брат, фермер, тоже хочет приехать?
TEXT.German: Vielleicht möchte sein jüngerer Bruder, der noch auf dem elterlichen Hof arbeitet, nach Amerika kommen?
TEXT.Italian: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Perhaps his youngest brother, who is a farmer at the homestead of his parents, wishes to come.

TEXT.English: As I recall his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage..
TEXT.French: Насколько я помню, его двоюродный брат находится в бегах, потому что он браконьер. Он хочет прийти? Объясните, что я не буду платить за его проезд.
TEXT.German: Wurde sein Vetter nicht vom Landbüttel daheim als Wilderer gesucht? Nun, er kann hier gerne ein neues Leben anfangen. Für die Überfahrt hat er aber selber aufzukommen.
TEXT.Italian: I remember that his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage.
TEXT.Spanish: I remember that his cousin is on the run because he is a poacher. Does he want to come? But I cannot pay for his passage.

TEXT.English: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen near %s2_city has proclaimed that an angel has revealed to him the sacred Book of Mormon.
TEXT.French: Житель [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] из [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] заявил, что ангел открыл ему священную Книгу Мормона.
TEXT.German: Im %s1:2_civ_adjective Reich behauptet ein Mann, ein Engel hätte ihm nahe der Stadt %s2_city das Buch Mormon überreicht.
TEXT.Italian: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen proclaims, that an angel has given the Book of Mormon to him near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A %s1_civ_adjective citizen proclaims, that an angel has given the Book of Mormon to him near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A man proclaims that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has revealed a holy book inscribed on plates of silver. The news is spreading like wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?
TEXT.French: Один человек говорит, что в пустыне недалеко от [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] ангел явил ему Священную Книгу, начертанную на серебряных пластинах.[NEWLINE]Эта новость распространяется по нашим колониям со скоростью лесного пожара. Почти все жители города верят ему и этой так называемой Книге Мормона. Что нам с этим делать?
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Ein Mann behauptet, ein Engel hätte ihm in der Wüste nahe der Stadt %s2_city eine heilige Schrift überreicht.[NEWLINE]Die Nachricht verbreitet sich wie ein Lauffeuer, fast alle Stadtbewohner folgen ihm und diesem Buch Mormon bereits. Was sollen wir tun?
TEXT.Italian: Governor, a man proclaims, that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has given a holy book to him. The news is spreading like a wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city do believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, a man proclaims, that in the desert near %s2_city an angel has given a holy book to him. The news is spreading like a wildfire in our colony, nearly all inhabitants of the city do believe him and this so called Book of Mormon. What should we do?

TEXT.English: Blasphemy! The hot sun seems to have addled his mind! Quickly, raise a tithe from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need God's help.
TEXT.French: Кощунство! Жаркое солнце, кажется, смутило его разум! Быстро соберите десятину со всех богобоязненных горожан и отправьте миссионера в этот город! Эти заблудшие души нуждаются в Божьей помощи.
TEXT.German: Dem hat die Wüstensonne wohl das Hirn verdorrt! Rasch, sammelt Geld von den gottesfürchtigen Bürgern und schickt einen Missionar in die Stadt! Die verirrten Seelen brauchen unsere Hilfe.
TEXT.Italian: The hot sun seems to have toasted his mind! Quick, collect some monex from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need our help.
TEXT.Spanish: The hot sun seems to have toasted his mind! Quick, collect some monex from all the godfearing citizens and send a missionary to this city! These lost souls need our help.

TEXT.English: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. To each his own faith, as long as they pay their taxes ...
TEXT.French: Не мешайте ему. Пути Господа неисповедимы. Каждому своя вера, пока платят налоги...
TEXT.German: Lasst ihn gewähren, Gottes Wege sind unergründlich. Ein jeder mag seinen Glauben leben, wie es ihm beliebt, solange er seine Steuern zahlt ...
TEXT.Italian: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. Everybody may live his faith, as wanted, as long as they pay their taxes ...
TEXT.Spanish: Do not stop him, the Lord works in mysterious ways. Everybody may live his faith, as wanted, as long as they pay their taxes ...

TEXT.English: Hallelujah, we truly do live in God´s own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.
TEXT.French: Аллилуйя, мы действительно живем в Божьей стране! Поддержите этого пророка, насколько это возможно. Я уже вижу, как пустыня цветет.
TEXT.German: Halleluja, wir leben wahrhaft in Gottes Reich auf Erden! Unterstützt diesen Propheten, so gut es geht. Ich sehe schon blühende Landschaften in der Wüste entstehen.
TEXT.Italian: Hallelujah, we truly do live in God´s own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.
TEXT.Spanish: Hallelujah, we truly do live in God´s own country! Support this prophet as good as we can. I already see the desert in bloom.

TEXT.English: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: В [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] колонии [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] бунт роялистов.
TEXT.German: Das %s1:3_civ_adjective Kolonialreich wird von Protesten treuer Royalisten erschüttert, sie gehen in %s2_city auf die Straße!
TEXT.Italian: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A riot in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies is taking place in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Governor, certain prominent citizens of %s2_city are protesting that you are not truly loyal to the sovereign. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!
TEXT.French: Милорд, некоторые видные граждане [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] заявляют, что на самом деле вы не лояльны к суверену. Вы должны ответить, но не забывайте о последствиях!
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Ein guter Teil der Bürger in %s2_city zieht protestierend in Richtung des örtlichen Regierungspalastes. Sie werfen Euch vor, dass Ihr unserem König nicht mehr loyal seid, einige bezichtigen Euch gar des Separatismus! Ihr müsst etwas tun, doch bedenkt, dass es Folgen haben könnte ...
TEXT.Italian: Governor, some of the citizens in %s2_city are protesting. They proclaim, that you are not loyal to the king anymore. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, some of the citizens in %s2_city are protesting. They proclaim, that you are not loyal to the king anymore. You have to react somehow, but mind the consequences!

TEXT.English: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse..
TEXT.French: Приведите ко мне лидера этой толпы и поднимите еще несколько королевских флагов. Простой диалог между двумя джентльменами за бокалом вина должен прояснить ситуацию. Я собираюсь сделать ему предложение, от которого он не сможет отказаться...
TEXT.German: Holt mir den führenden Kopf hierher und hängt noch zwei königliche Banner aus dem Fenster. Ein guter Schluck Wein und ein offenes Gespräch haben schon so manche Bluttat verhindert. Ich werde ihm ein Angebot machen, dass er nicht ablehnen kann.
TEXT.Italian: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.
TEXT.Spanish: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.

TEXT.English: ... maybe even the King will hear of your good manners ...
TEXT.French: ... может быть, Король услышит о ваших хороших манерах ...
TEXT.German: ... von solch wohlfeilem Gebaren könnte sogar der König erfahren ...
TEXT.Italian: ... maybe even the king will hear of your good manners ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... maybe even the king will hear of your good manners ...

TEXT.English: Let them talk! Freedom of speech and conscience for every man, that is our watchword.
TEXT.French: Пусть говорят! Свобода слова и совести для каждого человека - вот наш девиз.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie gewähren, der wache Geist und das freie Wort waren mir stets teuer. Ich unterdrücke sie nicht, sagt ihnen das. Sie sind hier mindestens so frei, ihre unverbrüchliche Königsliebe zu leben, wie in unserem Mutterland.
TEXT.Italian: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I won´t opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I won´t opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.

TEXT.English: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...
TEXT.French: ... такого рода разговоры могут вызвать некоторые проблемы ...
TEXT.German: ... dieses royalistische Palaver könnte uns noch zu schaffen machen ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this kind of talk may cause some trouble ...

TEXT.English: Let our brave troops disperse them, but press them no further! I will not see blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.French: Пусть войска разгонят эту толпу горячих голов... Только никакого кровопролития! Пусть используют приклады винтовок, если нужно, но ни в коем случае не стрелять!
TEXT.German: Lasst die Truppen diesen Haufen auflösen, mit diesen Hitzköpfen lässt sich einfach nicht diskutieren ... Ich will aber kein Blutvergießen, also denkt daran, zur Not nutzt den Gewehrkolben, aber dass mir kein Schuss fällt!
TEXT.Italian: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I don´t want any blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.Spanish: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I don´t want any blood spilled in our streets.

TEXT.English: ... this could make them even more angry ...
TEXT.French: ...это может ещё больше разозлить лоялистов...
TEXT.German: ... das wird für Groll und Wut sorgen, die Königstreuen könnten uns noch einen Denkzettel verpassen ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this acting could make them even more angry ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this acting could make them even more angry ...

TEXT.English: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, lest they seize us from behind later.
TEXT.French: Расстрелять их, лишить их собственности, изгнать их! Лучше мы избавимся от этой сволочи сейчас, не то потом они вонзят нам нож в спину.
TEXT.German: Kartätscht dieses Pack zusammen, enteignet sie, jagt sie aus der Stadt! Besser wir bereinigen die Sache jetzt schnell und gründlich, als dass sie uns später in den Rücken fallen ...
TEXT.Italian: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.
TEXT.Spanish: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.

TEXT.English: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...
TEXT.French: ... это сложная вещь. Они точно захотят отомстить...
TEXT.German: ... ein heikler Schritt, die Lumpen werden sicher Rache üben ...
TEXT.Italian: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... this is tough stuff, they will seek revenge for sure ...

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective King sends a gift to his loyal governor.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] Король посылает подарок своему верному губернатору.
TEXT.German: Der %s1:3_civ_adjective König zeigt sich gegenüber seinem treuen Gouverneur erkenntlich.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective king sends a gift to his loyal governor.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective king sends a gift to his loyal governor.

TEXT.English: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His Highness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life along with best regards.
TEXT.French: Кажется, милорд, что ваш труд признан Королевским двором. Его Величество посылает двух своих самых выдающихся солдат защищать вашу жизнь.
TEXT.German: Es scheint, Gouverneur, dass Eure aufrichtigen Bemühungen um die königstreuen Bürger von %s2_city sogar am entfernten Hofe Eindruck schinden. Mit den besten Grüßen schickt Euch ihre königliche Hoheit zwei erlesene Soldaten als Leibwache.
TEXT.Italian: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His higness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life alog with best regards.
TEXT.Spanish: It seems, governor, that your unrefusable offer made its point at the royal court. His higness is sending you two of his best men to protect your life alog with best regards.

TEXT.English: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.
TEXT.French: В [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] колонии роялисты доставляют неприятности.
TEXT.German: Überall im %s1:2_civ_adjective Kolonialreich begehren die Royalisten auf.
TEXT.Italian: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.
TEXT.Spanish: In the %s1_civ_adjective colonies the royalists are causing trouble.

TEXT.English: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.
TEXT.French: Милорд, роялисты в полной мере пользуются своим правом на свободу слова. Их клубы и ложи повсюду. В основном в крупных городах, деревенские жители, пока, не участвуют.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Die Königstreuen scheinen von ihrem Recht auf freie Rede regen Gebrauch zu machen. Es bilden sich überall Logen und Clubs. Gerade die großen kulturellen Zentren des Landes scheinen diesen patriotischen Tendenzen anheim zu fallen. Unter der einfachen Bevölkerung auf dem Lande finden dererlei Grillen noch keinen Anklang.
TEXT.Italian: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, the royalists seem to make use of the freedom of speech. They are founding clubs and lodges everywhere. At the moment this is only a problem in the bigger cities, the countryside does not participate so far.

TEXT.English: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.
TEXT.French: Роялисты уничтожили еду в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] колониях.
TEXT.German: Royalisten haben in den %s1:2_civ_adjective Städten Nahrung vernichtet.
TEXT.Italian: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Royalists have destroyed food in the %s1_civ_adjective colonies.

TEXT.English: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.
TEXT.French: Милорд. Сторонники короля обманули нас. Они забрались во все зернохранилища во всех городах и уничтожили все съестное. Во многих местах хорошие люди помогали, потому что им сказали, что это вы отдали такой приказ! Роялисты напечатали поддельные объявления, в которых говорилось: "Из-за возмутительно высоких налогов первая обязанность граждан — выступить против Короля! В знак протеста уничтожить всю еду во всех городах!"
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! Die Königstreuen haben uns übel mitgespielt. Sie haben in allen Städten die Kornspeicher besetzt und begonnen, das Getreide und alles andere Essbare zu vernichten. Vielerorts beteiligten sich brave Leute an diesem Frevel, weil es hieß, es wäre Eure Order! Auf getürkten Anschlägen stand zu lesen: "Aufgrund der unverschämt hohen Steuern ist es erste Bürgerpflicht, sich dem König zu widersetzen! Vernichtet aus Protest alle Nahrungsmittel in allen Städten!"
TEXT.Italian: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.
TEXT.Spanish: Governor! The royalists hit us hard. They destroyed a lot of food in all the granaries of ours. Obviously, they tricked the local people and troops by proclaiming, that it was your order. The "food party" to protest against the king.

TEXT.English: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Газета в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_civ_adjective[COLOR_REVERT] городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] была взорвана роялистами.
TEXT.German: Royalisten haben in der %s3_civ_adjective Stadt %s2_city die Zeitung gesprengt!
TEXT.Italian: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Royalists blew up the newspaper in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...
TEXT.French: Милорд, МИЛОРД! В городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] было взорвано здание газеты! Это похоже на месть подпольного роялистского движения. Они нарисовали "Да здравствует король" на соседней стене и оставили глупую подпись "Сэр Секваф Юг".
TEXT.German: Gouverneur! GOUVERNEUR ! In %s2_city wurde die Zeitung in die Luft gejagt. Eine versprengte Gruppe Royalisten hat wohl Rache genommen. An einer Wirtshauswand in der Nähe stand in großen Lettern: "Es lebe der König!", unterzeichnet von einem gewissen Sir Sekwaf Yug. Es scheint ein Tarnname zu sein, so heißt doch kein ...
TEXT.Italian: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...
TEXT.Spanish: Governor, GOVERNOR! The Newspaper in %s2_city has been blown up! Some royalistic underground movement is out for revenge. They painted "Long live the king" on a nearby wall, signed by the name Sir Sekwaf Yug, quite a strange name, that not seems to be an ordinary name ...

TEXT.English: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.
TEXT.French: Они выглядят очень хорошими ребятами! Я хочу, чтобы с этого момента они стояли на страже возле моей кровати. Это улучшит мой сон.
TEXT.German: Das sind wahrlich stramme Kerls, mein Leib und Leben scheint mir bei ihnen in guten Händen. Postiert sie zu beiden Seiten des Bettes, auf dass mein Schlummer friedlich bleiben möge.
TEXT.Italian: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.
TEXT.Spanish: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.

TEXT.English: Don´t bother me again with these powdered fops! They give me a headache.
TEXT.French: Не беспокойте меня больше этими напудренными пижонами! Они вызывают у меня приступы мигрени.
TEXT.German: Davon kriege ich Kopfschmerzen, bitte, belästigt mich nicht weiter mit diesen gepuderten Affenhirnen.
TEXT.Italian: Don´t bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.
TEXT.Spanish: Don´t bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.

TEXT.English: The will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...
TEXT.French: Революционный энтузиазм ослабевает, но пока, по крайней мере, только в больших городах...
TEXT.German: ... die revolutionäre Begeisterung lässt nach, aber wenigstens nur in den großen Städten ...
TEXT.Italian: ... the will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...
TEXT.Spanish: ... the will for revolution is falling, at least just in the bigger cities ...

TEXT.English: A hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" gives me another idea..
TEXT.French: Дьявол их забери! Ладно, спасай, что можешь. Это единственное, что мы можем сейчас сделать... Однако, эта веселая "вечеринка" натолкнула меня на мысль...
TEXT.German: Ein teuflischer Plan, diese Hunde, rettet, was zu retten ist ... allein, der Wortlaut dieses Anschlages kommt mir wirklich bekannt vor.
TEXT.Italian: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.
TEXT.Spanish: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.

TEXT.English: Sheer perfidy! They´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, I will find him!
TEXT.French: Какое вероломство! Они зашли слишком далеко! Обыщите весь город, прочешите весь лес, перекопайте пустыню! Я найду это, это... как бы его ни звали, я найду его!
TEXT.German: WAS ZUM TEUFEL? Oh, diese Barbaren, durchsucht die Stadt, durchstöbert die Wälder, durchkämmt die Wüsten! Ich werde diesen, diesen ... na wie auch immer er heißt, kriegen!
TEXT.Italian: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, they´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!
TEXT.Spanish: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, they´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!

TEXT.English: The amount of gold and other treasure that is carried through our cities is getting attention, perhaps too much attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.
TEXT.French: Богатство этой страны поражает воображение! Сундуки, наполненные золотом, драгоценностями и разнообразными драгоценными камнями, хлынули в портовые города. Что ж, наблюдение таких вещей не всегда пробуждает в людях лучшие качества. Честно говоря, милорд, в тавернах и портовых кварталах уже ходят разговоры о том, какой склад стоит посетить. Если вы не предпримете что-то в ближайшее время, жадность отравит ваших хороших колонистов.
TEXT.German: Der Reichtum dieses Landes ist erstaunlich! Kisten voll Gold, Geschmeide und mannigfaltigen Gemmen strömen in die Hafenstädte. Nun, derartiges zu sehen befördert nicht immer das Beste in den Menschen. Um ehrlich zu sein, Gouverneur, man munkelt in den Spelunken und Hafenvierteln bereits, welches Lagerhaus einen Besuch gar lohnen würde. Wenn Ihr nicht bald etwas unternehmt, dann wird die Gier Eure braven Kolonisten vergiften.
TEXT.Italian: The amount of gold and other treasure, that is carried through our cities, is getting attention, a lot of attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.
TEXT.Spanish: The amount of gold and other treasure, that is carried through our cities, is getting attention, a lot of attention! Your citizens may take adavantage of such a temptation.

TEXT.English: They will not! Such talk is rubbish!
TEXT.French: Пустой разговор. Эти верные души никогда не станут вмешиваться в мою, ну, э-э, я имею в виду собственность Его Величества, конечно. Прочь! Не оскорбляйте мой слух такими выдумками.
