TEXT.Italian: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.

TEXT.English: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.French: Врач из Европы хочет бороться с болезнями поселенцев, которые распространяются в деревнях индейцев.
TEXT.German: Ein Arzt aus Europa will die Krankheiten des Weissen Mannes bekämpfen, die sich in den Dörfern der Ureinwohner verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.Spanish: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.

TEXT.English: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.French: В один из наших городов приехал врач из Европы. Он слышал о страданиях коренных жителей Нового Света и теперь хочет бороться с болезнями поселенцев, распространяющимися в деревнях индейцев.
TEXT.German: Ein Arzt aus Europa ist in einer unserer Städte eingetroffen und will die Krankheiten des Weissen Mannes bekämpfen, die sich in den Dörfern der Ureinwohner verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.Spanish: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.

TEXT.English: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.
TEXT.French: Это благородная миссия. У него есть наша полная поддержка.
TEXT.German: Dieses noble Anliegen hat unsere volle Unterstützung.
TEXT.Italian: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.

TEXT.English: A man with such valuable knowledge cannot be left wandering in the wilderness. He must stay in our city and cure the sick there.
TEXT.French: Человека с такими ценными знаниями нельзя оставлять блуждать по пустыне. Он должен остаться в нашем городе и лечить там больных.
TEXT.German: Ein Mann mit solch wertvollem Wissen, können wir nicht einfach in die Wildnis lassen. Er soll in userer Stadt bleiben und die Kranken dort heilen.
TEXT.Italian: A man with such valuable knowledge cannot be left wandering in the wilderness. He must stay in our city and cure the sick there.
TEXT.Spanish: A man with such valuable knowledge cannot be left wandering in the wilderness. He must stay in our city and cure the sick there.

TEXT.English: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis.
TEXT.French: Один из наших транспортов попал в аварию и сломал ось.
TEXT.German: Einer unserer Warentransporte hatte einen Unfall und brach sich dabei die Achse.
TEXT.Italian: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis.
TEXT.Spanish: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis.

TEXT.English: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis. It is quite difficult but possible to repair. If we pay to send some help, it will probably be repaired again sooner.
TEXT.French: Один из наших транспортов попал в аварию и сломал ось. Его можно отремонтировать. Если мы заплатим за помощь местному кузнецу, он починит ось быстрее, чем это сделают сопровождающие транспорт слуги.
TEXT.German: Einer unserer Warentransporte hatte einen Unfall und brach sich dabei die Achse. Der Schaden ist zwar schwerwiegend, kann aber repariert werden. Wenn wir etwas Geld zahlen um Hilfe zu schicken, wahrscheinlich sogar recht bald.
TEXT.Italian: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis. It is quite difficult but possible to repair. If we pay to send some help, it will probably be repaired again sooner.
TEXT.Spanish: One of our transports had an accident and broke its axis. It is quite difficult but possible to repair. If we pay to send some help, it will probably be repaired again sooner.

TEXT.English: Ah well, pay somebody to help repair the axis. We need that transport on the roads again soon.
TEXT.French: Ну ладно, заплати кому-нибудь, чтобы он помог починить ось. Нам нужен этот транспорт, чтобы поскорее начать движение.
TEXT.German: Nun gut, bezahlt jemanden damit er bei der Reparatur hilft. Wir brauchen dieses Fahrzeug bald wieder auf der Strasse.
TEXT.Italian: TAh well, pay somebody to help repair the axis. We need that transport on the roads again soon.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah well, pay somebody to help repair the axis. We need that transport on the roads again soon.

TEXT.English: We have full confidence, that our men will be able to repair the axis themselves.
TEXT.French: Мы полностью уверены, что наши люди смогут сами отремонтировать ось.
TEXT.German: Wir haben vollstes Vertrauen, dass unsere Männer den Schaden selbst beheben werden.
TEXT.Italian: We have full confidence, that our men will be able to repair the axis themselves.
TEXT.Spanish: We have full confidence, that our men will be able to repair the axis themselves.

TEXT.English: An officer recognized a petty criminal as a former brother in arms.
TEXT.French: Офицер признал в мелком преступнике бывшего товарища по оружию.
TEXT.German: Ein Offizier hat einen Kriminellen als ehemaligen Waffenbruder wiedererkannt.
TEXT.Italian: An officer recognized a petty criminal as a former brother in arms.
TEXT.Spanish: An officer recognized a petty criminal as a former brother in arms.

TEXT.English: One of our officers approaches us and tells us that he recognized one of the petty criminals as a former brother in arms. He tells that that man had been rewarded for bravery and was a good soldier, only having serious problems with discipline and alcohol. He had been imprisoned for beating a superior officer when that superior insulted him. Our officer pleads us to give the criminal a second chance.
TEXT.French: Один из наших офицеров пришел сказать нам, что узнал в одном из каторжников бывшего товарища по оружию. Он говорит, что мужчину наградили за храбрость, хотя у него и были серьезные проблемы с дисциплиной и алкоголем. Он был заключен в тюрьму за нападение на вышестоящего офицера, который оскорбил его. Наш офицер умоляет нас дать преступнику второй шанс.
TEXT.German: Einer unserer Offiziere hat einen der Kriminellen als ehemaligen Soldaten und Waffenbruder wiedererkannt. Dieser soll ein guter man und mutiger Soldat gewesen sein. Jedoch mit Problemen bei der Disziplin und mit dem Alkohol. Er wurde verurteilt, weil er einen Vorgesetzten aufgrund einer Beleidigung zusammengeschlagen hat. Unser Offizier bittet, dass wir Gnade erweisen und dem Mann eine zweite Chance geben.
TEXT.Italian: One of our officers approaches us and tells us that he recognized one of the petty criminals as a former brother in arms. He tells that that man had been rewarded for bravery and was a good soldier, only having serious problems with discipline and alcohol. He had been imprisoned for beating a superior officer when that superior insulted him. Our officer pleads us to give the criminal a second chance.
TEXT.Spanish: One of our officers approaches us and tells us that he recognized one of the petty criminals as a former brother in arms. He tells that that man had been rewarded for bravery and was a good soldier, only having serious problems with discipline and alcohol. He had been imprisoned for beating a superior officer when that superior insulted him. Our officer pleads us to give the criminal a second chance.

TEXT.English: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.
TEXT.French: Если он так недисциплинирован, мы не можем отправить его в войска. Но мы можем дать ему шанс стать разведчиком.
TEXT.German: Wenn er so undiszipliniert ist, kann er nicht bei der Truppe dienen. Er soll es aber als Scout versuchen.
TEXT.Italian: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.
TEXT.Spanish: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.

TEXT.English: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.
TEXT.French: Дайте ему инструменты. Он будет работать с первопроходцами. Надеюсь, мы не пожалеем об этом.
TEXT.German: Gebt ihm Schaufel und Spitzhacke. Er kann bei den Pionieren anfangen. Hoffentlich werden wir dies nicht bereuen.
TEXT.Italian: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.
TEXT.Spanish: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.

TEXT.English: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.
TEXT.French: Нам очень жаль, но он осужден по закону.
TEXT.German: Er wurde rechtens verurteilt. Daran kann nichts geändert werden.
TEXT.Italian: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.
TEXT.Spanish: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.

TEXT.English: A Native Slave has saved the life of a colonist.
TEXT.French: Туземный раб спас жизнь колонисту.
TEXT.German: Ein Ureinwohnersklave hat das Leben eines Siedlers gerettet.
TEXT.Italian: A Native Slave has saved the life of a colonist.
TEXT.Spanish: A Native Slave has saved the life of a colonist.

TEXT.English: A Native Slave has saved the life of one of our colonists when some horses went wild and were going to stamped over him. The colonist now demands, that this slave is set free for his bravery.
TEXT.French: Раб-абориген спас жизнь одному из наших колонистов, который попал под копыта диких лошадей. Теперь спасённый колонист просит, чтобы этого раба освободили за его храбрость.
TEXT.German: Ein Ureinwohnersklave hat das Leben eines unserer Siedlers gerettet, als einige Pferde durchgingen und den Siedler beinahe überrannte. Der Siedler bitten nun, dass der Ureinwohnersklave aufgrund seines Mutes die Freiheit bekommt.
TEXT.Italian: A Native Slave has saved the life of one of our colonists when some horses went wild and were going to stamped over him. The colonist now demands, that this slave is set free for his bravery.
TEXT.Spanish: A Native Slave has saved the life of one of our colonists when some horses went wild and were going to stamped over him. The colonist now demands, that this slave is set free for his bravery.

TEXT.English: Such bravery must indeed be rewarded. This Native shall live in our city as a free man from now on.
TEXT.French: Такая храбрость действительно должна быть вознаграждена. Отныне этот туземец будет жить в нашем городе как свободный человек.
TEXT.German: Solcher Mut muss wahrlich belohnt werden. Dieser Wilde soll vom heutigen Tage als Freier man leben.
TEXT.Italian: Such bravery must indeed be rewarded. This Native shall live in our city as a free man from now on.
TEXT.Spanish: Such bravery must indeed be rewarded. This Native shall live in our city as a free man from now on.

TEXT.English: Give this Native some weapons and promise him a good salary if he will serve us in our army. Such bravery needs to be used.
TEXT.French: Дайте этому Туземцу оружие и пообещайте ему хорошее жалованье, если он будет служить в нашей армии. Такая храбрость является образцовой.
TEXT.German: Gebt diesem Wilden Waffen und versprecht ihm einen gerechten Lohn, wenn er in unserer Armee dient. Solcher Mut muss eingesetzt werden.
TEXT.Italian: Give this Native some weapons and promise him a good salary if he will serve us in our army. Such bravery needs to be used.
TEXT.Spanish: Give this Native some weapons and promise him a good salary if he will serve us in our army. Such bravery needs to be used.

TEXT.English: A Statesman is using his diplomatic connections.
TEXT.French: Государственный деятель пользуется своими дипломатическими связями.
TEXT.German: Ein Staatsmann nutzt seine diplomatischen Beziehungen.
TEXT.Italian: A Statesman is using his diplomatic connections.
TEXT.Spanish: A Statesman is using his diplomatic connections.

TEXT.English: One of our Statesmen told us, that he does have some diplomatic relations to another Statesman from one of our colonial neighbours. He says that they could even be called friends. He also knows that the other Statesman is not very satisfied with his current employment and could be convinced to work for us instead.
TEXT.French: Один из наших государственных деятелей говорит, что у него есть дипломатические связи с государственным деятелем одного из наших колониальных соседей. Их можно даже назвать друзьями. Он также знает, что другой государственный деятель недоволен своей нынешней работой и его можно убедить перейти работать к нам.
TEXT.German: Einer unserer Staatsmänner berichtet uns, dass er diplatische Beziehungen zu einem andere Staatsmann eines unsere europäischen Nachbarn hat und diesen sogar als Freund bezeichnet. Er weiss von diesem Staatsmann, dass dieser mit seiner aktuellen Stelle unzufrieden ist und überzeugt werden könnte stattdessen für uns zu arbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: One of our Statesmen told us, that he does have some diplomatic relations to another Statesman from one of our colonial neighbours. He says that they could even be called friends. He also knows that the other Statesman is not very satisfied with his current employment and could be convinced to work for us instead.
TEXT.Spanish: One of our Statesmen told us, that he does have some diplomatic relations to another Statesman from one of our colonial neighbours. He says that they could even be called friends. He also knows that the other Statesman is not very satisfied with his current employment and could be convinced to work for us instead.

TEXT.English: The Statesman shall use this connection and offer the other Statesman a lucrative position in our administration.
TEXT.French: Государственный деятель должен использовать эту связь, чтобы предложить другому чиновнику прибыльную должность в нашей администрации.
TEXT.German: Der Staatsmann soll seine Beziehungen nutzen und seinem Kollegen bei uns eine bessere Stelle als bei seinem bisherigen Arbeitgeber anbieten.
TEXT.Italian: The Statesman shall use this connection and offer the other Statesman a lucrative position in our administration.
TEXT.Spanish: The Statesman shall use this connection and offer the other Statesman a lucrative position in our administration.

TEXT.English: We should better not risk angering our neighbours.
TEXT.French: Нам лучше не рисковать и не злить соседей.
TEXT.German: Wir sollten es vermeiden unsere Nachbarn zu verärgern.
TEXT.Italian: We should better not risk angering our neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: We should better not risk angering our neighbours.

TEXT.English: Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity.
TEXT.French: Работа печатного станка в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die Druckerpresse in %s2_city hat noch freie Druckkapazität.
TEXT.Italian: Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity.
TEXT.Spanish: Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity.

TEXT.English: The Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity. But the citizens ask for something else than political pamphlets to be printed.
TEXT.French: Печатный станок в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] работает с утра и до поздней ночи. Однако горожане хотели бы видеть что-то помимо политических брошюр.
TEXT.German: Die Druckerpresse in %s2_city hat noch freie Druckkapazität. Die Bewohner der Stadt bitten aber, dass etwas anderes als politische Pamphlete gedruckt werden solle.
TEXT.Italian: The Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity. But the citizens ask for something else than political pamphlets to be printed.
TEXT.Spanish: The Printing Press in %s2_city still has printing capacity. But the citizens ask for something else than political pamphlets to be printed.

TEXT.English: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.
TEXT.French: Ну тогда напечатайте несколько отрывков из Библии. Мы будем распространять слово Иисуса Христа и его апостолов.
TEXT.German: Dann druckt Passage aus der Bibel. Wir werden die Worte Jesus Christi und der Apostel verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.
TEXT.Spanish: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.

TEXT.English: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.
TEXT.French: Мы могли бы напечатать кое-какие интересные новости из колоний. Возможно, время от времени будет появляться какая-нибудь занимательная история.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten Nachrichten aus den Kolonien drucken. Vielleicht auch eine unterhaltsame Geschichte von Zeit zu Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.
TEXT.Spanish: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.

TEXT.English: Experienced Sailors to be hired in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Опытные моряки для найма в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Erfahrene Seeleute wollen in %s2_city angeheuert werden.
TEXT.Italian: Experienced Sailors to be hired in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Experienced Sailors to be hired in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Experienced Sailors have arrived in %s2_city and are looking for employment. They could be hired for one of our ships. They look like they have gone through some really hard times.
TEXT.French: Опытные моряки прибыли в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] в поисках работы. Они могли бы быть полезны на одном из наших кораблей. Они выглядят так, будто пережили действительно тяжелые времена.
TEXT.German: Erfahrene Seeleute sind in %s2_city eingetroffen und suchen nach Arbeit. Wir könnten sie als Besatzung für eines unserer Schiffe anheuern. Sie scheinen harte Zeiten durchgemacht zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: Experienced Sailors have arrived in %s2_city and are looking for employment. They could be hired for one of our ships. They look like they have gone through some really hard times.
TEXT.Spanish: Experienced Sailors have arrived in %s2_city and are looking for employment. They could be hired for one of our ships. They look like they have gone through some really hard times.

TEXT.English: Then hurry up, before some other ship from another nation or a trading company will hire them first.
TEXT.French: Тогда поторопитесь, пока корабль другой страны или торговая компания не наняли их первыми.
TEXT.German: Dann lasst Eile walten, bevor ein anderes Schiff einer anderen Nation oder einer Handelskompanie sie zuerst anheuert.
TEXT.Italian: Then hurry up, before some other ship from another nation or a trading company will hire them first.
TEXT.Spanish: Then hurry up, before some other ship from another nation or a trading company will hire them first.

TEXT.English: The crews of our ship are experienced enough. We don't need to hire such scum.
TEXT.French: Экипажи нашего корабля достаточно опытны. Нам не нужно нанимать таких подонков.
TEXT.German: Die Mannschaften unserer Schiffe sind erfahren genug. Wir brauchen solchen Abschaum nicht auf unseren Schiffen.
TEXT.Italian: The crews of our ship are experienced enough. We don't need to hire such scum.
TEXT.Spanish: The crews of our ship are experienced enough. We don't need to hire such scum.

TEXT.English: A bishop was appointed in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Епископ был назначен в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Ein Bischof wurde in %s2_city ernannt.
TEXT.Italian: A bishop was appointed in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A bishop was appointed in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Authorities of the church have contacted us. They say that the colonies need to have a Bishop to guide the believers. One of our Priests in %s2_city fulfills all criterias and could be appointed to become our Bishop. The burocratic act however is expensive.
TEXT.French: С нами связались представители Святой церкви. Говорят, что колониям нужен епископ, чтобы направлять верующих. Один из наших священников в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] отвечает всем требованиям и может стать нашим епископом. Однако добиться его назначения взамен назначенного из Европы будет стоить приличной суммы.
TEXT.German: Authoritäten der Kriche haben uns kontaktiert. Sie sagen, dass die Kolonien einen Bischof brauchen um die Gläubigen zu führen. Einer unsere Prediger in %s2_city erfüllt die Kriterien und kann zum Bischof ernannt werden. Der bürokratische Vorgang der Ernennung ist jedoch aufwendig und teuer.
TEXT.Italian: Authorities of the church have contacted us. They say that the colonies need to have a Bishop to guide the believers. One of our Priests in %s2_city fulfills all criterias and could be appointed to become our Bishop. The burocratic act however is expensive.
TEXT.Spanish: Authorities of the church have contacted us. They say that the colonies need to have a Bishop to guide the believers. One of our Priests in %s2_city fulfills all criterias and could be appointed to become our Bishop. The burocratic act however is expensive.

TEXT.English: We know the man and he is truly worthy of becoming our spiritual leader. Tell the authorities of the church that we will pay for all necessary expenses to appoint him.
TEXT.French: Мы знаем этого человека и он действительно достоин стать нашим духовным лидером. Скажите церковным властям, что мы оплатим все необходимые расходы, чтобы назначить его.
TEXT.German: Wir kennen diesen Mann und er ist absolut würdig unser geistlicher Führer zu werden. Richtet den Authoritäten der Kriche aus, dass wir für alle Ausgaben der Ernennung aufkommen werden.
TEXT.Italian: We know the man and he is truly worthy of becoming our spiritual leader. Tell the authorities of the church that we will pay for all necessary expenses to appoint him.
TEXT.Spanish: We know the man and he is truly worthy of becoming our spiritual leader. Tell the authorities of the church that we will pay for all necessary expenses to appoint him.

TEXT.English: That is a lot of money for our colonies to pay. Although having a bishop will one day become necessary, we are still only few and can currently not afford it.
TEXT.French: Это большие деньги для наших колоний. Хотя однажды епископ станет необходим, сейчас нас слишком мало, чтобы мы могли позволить себе его.
TEXT.German: Das ist sehr viel Geld, dass wir zahlen müssten. Obwohl ein Bischof sicherlich irgendwann angemessen sein wird, sind wir momentan noch wenige und können uns das nicht leisten.
TEXT.Italian: That is a lot of money for our colonies to pay. Although having a bishop will one day become necessary, we are still only few and can currently not afford it.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a lot of money for our colonies to pay. Although having a bishop will one day become necessary, we are still only few and can currently not afford it.

TEXT.English: Rumors are spreading that coca leaves have positive effect on working morale of slaves.
TEXT.French: Ходят слухи, что листья коки улучшают моральный дух рабов.
TEXT.German: Gerüchte verbreiten sich, dass Cocablätter sich positiv auf die Arbeitsmoral von Sklaven auswirken.
TEXT.Italian: Rumors are spreading that coca leaves have positive effect on working morale of slaves.
TEXT.Spanish: Rumors are spreading that coca leaves have positive effect on working morale of slaves.

TEXT.English: A slave trader has approached us to offer a business deal because he heard about the positive effects of Coca Leaves on working morale of slaves. He offers us some of his slaves in exchange for a load of our coca leaves.
TEXT.French: Прослышав про то, что употребление листьев коки позволяет рабам усерднее трудиться с нами связался работорговец и предложил сделку. Он хочет обменять своих рабов на наши листья коки.
TEXT.German: Ein Sklavenhändler hat uns kontaktiert um uns ein Geschäft vorzuschlagen, da er von der positiven Wirkung von Cocablättern auf die Arbeitsmoral von Sklaven gehört hat. Er bietet uns einige seiner Skalven im Austausch für eine Ladung unserer Cocablätter.
TEXT.Italian: A slave trader has approached us to offer a business deal because he heard about the positive effects of Coca Leaves on working morale of slaves. He offers us some of his slaves in exchange for a load of our coca leaves.
TEXT.Spanish: A slave trader has approached us to offer a business deal because he heard about the positive effects of Coca Leaves on working morale of slaves. He offers us some of his slaves in exchange for a load of our coca leaves.

TEXT.English: That is an interesting proposal. Tell the slave trader that we accept the deal.
TEXT.French: Это интересное предложение. Скажите работорговцу, что мы согласны на сделку.
TEXT.German: Das ist ein interessanter Vorschlag. Richtet dem Sklavenhänlder aus, dass wir den Handel annehmen.
TEXT.Italian: That is an interesting proposal. Tell the slave trader that we accept the deal.
TEXT.Spanish: That is an interesting proposal. Tell the slave trader that we accept the deal.

TEXT.English: We are not interested in such a deal.
TEXT.French: Нам не интересна такая сделка.
TEXT.German: Wir sind an solch einem Handel nicht interessiert.
TEXT.Italian: We are not interested in such a deal.
TEXT.Spanish: We are not interested in such a deal.

TEXT.English: Rumors are spreading that excessive consume of coca leaves is causing problems in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Ходят слухи, что в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] чрезмерное употребление листьев коки вызывает проблемы.
TEXT.German: Gerüchte verbreiten sich, dass exzessiver Konsum von Cocablätter in %s2_city zu Problemen führte.
TEXT.Italian: Rumors are spreading that excessive consume of coca leaves is causing problems in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Rumors are spreading that excessive consume of coca leaves is causing problems in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Mylord, we are hearing reports that the consume of coca leaves in %s2_city has very negative effects on the morale and behaviour of its citizens. Some worried people even demand, that all coca leaves shall be burnt.
TEXT.French: Милорд, мы получаем сообщения о том, что употребление коки в городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] очень негативно сказывается на моральном духе и поведении людей. Некоторые встревоженные граждане даже требуют, чтобы все листья коки были сожжены.
TEXT.German: Mylord, wir hören immer mehr Berichte, dass der Konsum von Cocablättern in %s2_city sehr schlechte Auswirkungen auf die Moral und das Verhalten seiner Bevölkerung hat. Einige besorgte Bürger bitten sogar darum, dass alle Cocablätter verbrannt werden.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, we are hearing reports that the consume of coca leaves in %s2_city has very negative effects on the morale and behaviour of its citizens. Some worried people even demand, that all coca leaves shall be burnt.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, we are hearing reports that the consume of coca leaves in %s2_city has very negative effects on the morale and behaviour of its citizens. Some worried people even demand, that all coca leaves shall be burnt.

TEXT.English: That is worrying indeed. We shall burn all these devlish plants before our good citizens get harmed.
TEXT.French: Это действительно вызывает беспокойство. Мы сожжем все эти дьявольские растения, пока не пострадали наши добрые граждане.
TEXT.German: Das ist in der Tat Besorgnis erregend. Wir sollten all diese teuflischen Pflanzen verbrennen, bevor unsere guten Bürger Schaden nehmen.
TEXT.Italian: That is worrying indeed. We shall burn all these devlish plants before our good citizens get harmed.
TEXT.Spanish: That is worrying indeed. We shall burn all these devlish plants before our good citizens get harmed.

TEXT.English: Leave us alone with such stupidities. One day you might even tell us that alcohol is dangerous as well.
TEXT.French: Оставьте нас в покое с такими глупостями. Однажды ты скажешь нам, что даже алкоголь опасен.
TEXT.German: Lasst uns mit solch einem Unsinn in Ruhe. Eines Tages werde ihr uns noch erzählen, dass Alkohol ebenfalls gefährlich sei.
TEXT.Italian: Leave us alone with such stupidities. One day you might even tell us that alcohol is dangerous as well.
TEXT.Spanish: Leave us alone with such stupidities. One day you might even tell us that alcohol is dangerous as well.

TEXT.English: His Majesty has delegated a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.
TEXT.French: Из-за увеличения числа колоний Его Величество направил в Новый Свет вице-регента.
TEXT.German: Es heißt der König habe aufgrund der steigenden Zahl von Kolonien in der Neuen Welt einen Gouverneur nach %s2_city entsandt.
TEXT.Italian: His Majesty has delegated a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.
TEXT.Spanish: His Majesty has delegated a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.

TEXT.English: Mylord, your colonies are growing fast and faster but the administration leaves a lot to be desired. The population parties with the natives instead of paying homage to the king. This is unacceptable. Therefore His Majesty has decided to delegate a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.
TEXT.French: Милорд, наши колонии быстро разрастаются, но управление ими оставляет желать лучшего. Это неприемлемо. Поэтому для удержания контроля над новыми землями Его Величество решил направил к нам вице-регента.
TEXT.German: Mylord, die Anzahl der von Euch verwalteten Kolonien in der Neuen Welt wächst stetig und die Verwaltungsstrukturen lassen doch noch arg zu wünschen übrig. Wir hörten, dass die Bevölkerung lieber mit den Wilden feiert als dem König zu huldigen. Wir haben daher entschieden, den Cousin Dritten Grades meiner Frau als Statthalter in die Neue Welt zu entsenden, um die Verwaltung der Kolonien neu zu ordnen.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, your colonies are growing fast and faster but the administration leaves a lot to be desired. The population parties with the natives instead of paying homage to the king. This is unacceptable. Therefore His Majesty has decided to delegate a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, your colonies are growing fast and faster but the administration leaves a lot to be desired. The population parties with the natives instead of paying homage to the king. This is unacceptable. Therefore His Majesty has decided to delegate a vicegerent into your colonies in order to regain control.

TEXT.English: Majesty, we are very pleased that the crown will support our efforts in the New World. We will prepare the chamber for the honourable lord.
TEXT.French: Ваше Величество, мы очень рады, что Корона поддержит наши усилия в Новом Свете. Мы подготовим комнату для достопочтенного лорда.
TEXT.German: Majestät, wir sind Euch für Eure Unterstützung äußerst dankbar. In der Tat lässt die Verwaltung unserer Kolonien noch sehr zu wünschen übrig. Wir werden die Gemächer für seine Gnaden vorbereiten lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Majesty, we are very pleased that the crown will support our efforts in the New World. We will prepare the chamber for the honourable lord.
TEXT.Spanish: Majesty, we are very pleased that the crown will support our efforts in the New World. We will prepare the chamber for the honourable lord.

TEXT.English: Pah, the courtier would be confounded. Majesty, we will manage our colonies ourselves and better than a courtier from Europe. We will use the money for the development of the colony instead of preparing the chamber for your spy.
TEXT.French: Ну уж нет. Ваше Величество, мы будем управлять нашими колониями сами и гораздо лучше, чем какой-то хлыщ из Европы. Мы потратим деньги на развитие колонии вместо того, чтобы готовить камеру для вашего шпиона.
TEXT.German: Noch ein Höfling, der uns hier sagt was wir zu tun uns zu lassen haben? Pah! Der soll bleiben wo der Pfeffer wächst, Majestät. Ihr werdet sehen, wir werden die Kolonien für Euch auf Vordermann bringen!
TEXT.Italian: Pah, the courtier would be confounded. Majesty, we will manage our colonies ourselves and better than a courtier from Europe. We will use the money for the development of the colony instead of preparing the chamber for your spy.
TEXT.Spanish: Pah, the courtier would be confounded. Majesty, we will manage our colonies ourselves and better than a courtier from Europe. We will use the money for the development of the colony instead of preparing the chamber for your spy.

TEXT.English: It seems that a well educated refugee intends to sail into the New World.
TEXT.French: Кажется, хорошо образованный беженец собирается перебраться в Новый Свет.
TEXT.German: Ein Studierter möchte in die Neue Welt reisen und sich %s2_city anschließen.
TEXT.Italian: It seems that a well educated refugee intends to sail into the New World.
TEXT.Spanish: It seems that a well educated refugee intends to sail into the New World.

TEXT.English: Mylord, the benefits of liberty in the New World obviously also causes well educated people to leave their homes and to sail into the New Word. It seems that a graduate wishes to join our own colonies, in case we are willing to pay the passage for him.
TEXT.French: Милорд, достоинства свобод Нового Света заставляют даже образованных людей задуматься о переезде. Выпускник одного университета желает присоединиться к нашим колониям, если мы оплатим его проезд.
TEXT.German: Mylord, die Vorzüge der Freiheit in der Neuen Welt lassen auch die Gebildeten aufhorchen. Es heißt, dass einer dieser Studierten sich unseren Kolonien anschließen würde, wenn wir ihm die überfahrt bezahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, the benefits of liberty in the New World obviously also causes well educated people to leave their homes and to sail into the New Word. It seems that a graduate wishes to join our own colonies, in case we are willing to pay the passage for him.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, the benefits of liberty in the New World obviously also causes well educated people to leave their homes and to sail into the New Word. It seems that a graduate wishes to join our own colonies, in case we are willing to pay the passage for him.

TEXT.English: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!
TEXT.French: Для разнообразия в наших колониях нужен хорошо образованный человек. Мы не останемся колонией рабочих и крестьян. Выдайте ему вексель!
TEXT.German: Wir könnten zur Abwechslung mal einen Akademiker brauchen. Wir wollen ja nicht eine Kolonie von Arbeitern und Bauern bleiben. Stellt ihm den Wechsel aus!
TEXT.Italian: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!
TEXT.Spanish: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!

TEXT.English: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.
TEXT.French: Честно говоря, нам не нужен еще один денди, который тратит наше время и деньги. Чтобы основать эту колонию, нам нужны люди, готовые решать проблемы жизни здесь, в Новом Свете.
TEXT.German: Lieber nicht, wir sind gerade etwas knapp bei Kasse und diese Studierten sind doch alles Aufschneider, die nur den ganzen Tag im Salon verbringen und kluge Reden schwingen. Ich brauche Leute, die auch anpacken können.
TEXT.Italian: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.
TEXT.Spanish: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.

TEXT.English: A Master Train Oil Cooker wants to join %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Мастер вытопки ворвани хочет переехать в [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: In %s2_city möchte sich uns ein Meistertrankocher anschließen.
TEXT.Italian: A Master Train Oil Cooker wants to join %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A Master Train Oil Cooker wants to join %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Mylord, whaling along our coasts promises high profits. Lucky as we are one of the merchant vessels recently picked up a Master Train Oil Cooker in Europe, who likes to start a new life in the colonies. Shall we engage him?
TEXT.French: Милорд, китобойный промысел у наших берегов сулит большие прибыли. В Европе наше торговое судно недавно подобрало мастера вытопки ворвани, который хочет начать новую жизнь в колониях. Давайте наймём его?
TEXT.German: Mylord, der Walfang vor unseren Küsten würde gute Gewinne versprechen. Wie es der Zufall will, hat der Kapitän eines Handelsschiffes in Europa einen Meistertrankocher an Bord genommen, der hier ein neues Leben beginnen möchte. Sollen wir im eine Anstellung geben?
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, whaling along our coasts promises high profits. Lucky as we are one of the merchant vessels recently picked up a Master Train Oil Cooker in Europe, who likes to start a new life in the colonies. Shall we engage him?
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, whaling along our coasts promises high profits. Lucky as we are one of the merchant vessels recently picked up a Master Train Oil Cooker in Europe, who likes to start a new life in the colonies. Shall we engage him?

TEXT.English: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!
TEXT.French: На самом деле мы всегда хотели это сделать, но не было подходящего времени. Дайте ему работу!
TEXT.German: Perfekt, das wollten wir doch schon lange in Angriff nehmen. Stellt ihn ein!
TEXT.Italian: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!
TEXT.Spanish: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!

TEXT.English: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.
TEXT.French: С таким количеством пиратов, курсирующих сейчас в этом районе? У нас нет средств, чтобы все наши китобойные суда охранялись военными кораблями. А без защиты это бессмысленное занятие. Мы не можем нанять его в данный момент.
TEXT.German: Bei den vielen Piraten, die hier in dieser Gegend zur Zeit kreuzen? Wir haben nicht die Mittel, um alle unsere Walfänger von Kriegschiffen bewachen zu lassen. Und ohne Schutz ist das ein sinnloses Unterfangen. Wir können ihn derzeit nicht gebrauchen.
TEXT.Italian: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.

TEXT.English: A trading company intends to develop %s2_city as basis for their whaling activities.
TEXT.French: Торговая компания намеревается использовать [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] в качестве базы для китобойного промысла.
TEXT.German: Eine Handelskompanie möchte %s2_city als Basis für ihren Walfang ausbauen.
TEXT.Italian: A trading company intends to develop %s2_city as basis for their whaling activities.
TEXT.Spanish: A trading company intends to develop %s2_city as basis for their whaling activities.

TEXT.English: Mylord, a powerful trading company intends to develop one of our colonies as basis for their whaling activities in this area. We should all benefit from this deal. They are promising ships, men and construction material for new buildings, in case we grant to protect them and to expose taxes for whale fat and train oil.
TEXT.French: Милорд, могущественная торговая компания намеревается использовать один из наших городов в качестве порта китобойных судов. Мы все выиграем от этой сделки. Они обещают корабли и новые здания в обмен на нашу защиту. Мы же сможем собирать налоги за китовый жир и ворвань.
TEXT.German: Mylord, eine mächtige Handelskompanie möchte eine unserer Kolonien als Basis für ihren Walfang ausbauen. Davon würden wir sicher profitieren. Sie versprechen uns Schiffe, Männer und Baumaterial für neue Gebäude zu liefern, wenn wir im Gegenzug für Ihren Schutz sorgen und die Zölle auf Walspeck sowie Tranöl eine Weile aussetzen.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, a powerful trading company intends to develop one of our colonies as basis for their whaling activities in this area. We should all benefit from this deal. They are promising ships, men and construction material for new buildings, in case we grant to protect them and to expose taxes for whale fat and train oil.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, a powerful trading company intends to develop one of our colonies as basis for their whaling activities in this area. We should all benefit from this deal. They are promising ships, men and construction material for new buildings, in case we grant to protect them and to expose taxes for whale fat and train oil.

TEXT.English: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.
TEXT.French: Согласитесь, от этой сделки выиграет и колония и наш кошелек. Однако я предполагаю, что нам нужно будет успокоить наших соседей, промышляющих в этом районе.
TEXT.German: Das kommt uns sehr gelegen, die Region und unsere Geldbörse werden davon sehr profitieren. Also einverstanden, setzen Sie die entsprechenden Verträge auf. Die Steuern setz ohnehin der König fest. Mit unseren Nachbarn werden wir uns schon arrangieren.
TEXT.Italian: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.

TEXT.English: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.
TEXT.French: Бедные животные. Они нуждаются в нашей защите, а не в наших гарпунах. Кроме того, наши соседи уже ведут китобойный промысел в этом районе. Я не буду рисковать нашими отношениями.
TEXT.German: Diese armen Tiere. Sie benötigen unseren Schutz, nicht unsere Harpunen. Außerdem betreiben unsere Nachbarn hier bereits Walfang. Ich möchte die guten Beziehungen nicht gefährden.
TEXT.Italian: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.
TEXT.Spanish: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.

TEXT.English: Privateers are the pest of the seas.
TEXT.French: Каперы - чума морей.
TEXT.German: Freibeuter werden zur Plage der Meere.
TEXT.Italian: Privateers are the pest of the seas.
TEXT.Spanish: Privateers are the pest of the seas.

TEXT.English: Mylord, our neighbours have sent a diplomat. Hiy Excellency is very upset about the privateer activities around his harbours and the increasing losses of merchant vessels. He awaits that we revoke their letters of marque.
TEXT.French: Милорд, наши соседи прислали дипломата. Они очень расстроены тем, что каперы бродят вдоль их гаваней и грабят торговые суда. Они требуют, чтобы мы отозвали их каперские свидетельства.
TEXT.German: Mylord, Unsere Nachbarn haben einen Diplomaten geschickt. Seine Exzellenz ist sehr erbost über die zunehmende Anzahl von Schiffensverlusten durch Freibeuter. Man verlangt von uns, den Freibeutern ihre Kaperbriefe zu entziehen.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, our neighbours have sent a diplomat. Hiy Excellency is very upset about the privateer activities around his harbours and the increasing losses of merchant vessels. He awaits that we revoke their letters of marque.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, our neighbours have sent a diplomat. Hiy Excellency is very upset about the privateer activities around his harbours and the increasing losses of merchant vessels. He awaits that we revoke their letters of marque.

TEXT.English: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.
TEXT.French: Я согласен, эти грубияны были очень полезны в прошлом. Но теперь их успех сделал их высокомерными. Они начали нападения на наши собственные торговые суда. Мы отзовем их каперские свидетельства и выплатим им деньги.
TEXT.German: Ich stimme zu. Bisher waren diese rauen Gesellen ganz nützlich. Aber ihre Erfolge haben sie überheblich gemacht. Mir liegen Berichte vor, dass vereinzelt sogar bereits unsere eigenen Handelsschiffe angegriffen wurden. Wir werden die Anzahl der ausgegebenen Kaperbriefe reduzieren und die Freibeuter ausbezahlen.
TEXT.Italian: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.
TEXT.Spanish: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.

TEXT.English: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.
TEXT.French: Мы ничего не можем сделать. Эти каперские грамоты были выданы нашим собственным адмиралтейством и королем. Частные инвесторы волей-неволей не откажутся от права захвата иностранных торговых судов.
TEXT.German: Ja nun, dagegen können wir nichts machen. Die Kaperbriefe werden von der Admiralität auf Geheiß seiner Majestät ausgegeben. Und die privaten Eigner werden nicht gern auf ihre Profite verzichten wollen.
TEXT.Italian: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.
TEXT.Spanish: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.

TEXT.English: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.
TEXT.French: Отлично, наша стратегия вступает в силу! Мы не будем останавливаться сейчас. Кроме того, мы выдадим больше каперских свидетельств, чтобы бросить им вызов.
TEXT.German: Ha, also zeigt die Strategie Wirkung! Wir werden vor diesen Bastarden nicht zu Kreuze kriechen. Wir werden weitere Kaperbriefe ausstellen, um deren Handel noch mehr zu schwächen.
TEXT.Italian: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.
TEXT.Spanish: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.

TEXT.English: Private investors change from buccaneering to legal investments in merchant vessels.
TEXT.French: Частные инвесторы перешли от пиратства к легальным инвестициям в торговые суда.
TEXT.German: Private Eigner stellen ihre Freibeuter auf Handelsschiffahrt um.
TEXT.Italian: Private investors change from buccaneering to legal investments in merchant vessels.
TEXT.Spanish: Private investors change from buccaneering to legal investments in merchant vessels.

TEXT.English: Mylord, the private investors of the ships which letters of marque have been revoked have converted their privateers into merchant vessels and will not enhance our merchant fleet.
TEXT.French: Милорд, частные финансисты превратили свои пиратские корабли в торговые суда, которые больше не будут совершать набеги на наш торговый флот.
TEXT.German: Mylord, die Eigner der Freibeuter, deren Kaperbriefe wir eingezogen haben, haben ihr Schiff in ein Handelsschiff umgerüstet und werden von nun an unsere Handelsflotte verstärken.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, the private investors of the ships which letters of marque have been revoked have converted their privateers into merchant vessels and will not enhance our merchant fleet.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, the private investors of the ships which letters of marque have been revoked have converted their privateers into merchant vessels and will not enhance our merchant fleet.

TEXT.English: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.
TEXT.French: Действительно хорошо. Это успокоит наших соседей и укрепит нашу торговлю.
TEXT.German: Sehr gut, das wird unsere Nachbarn beruhigen und unseren Handel stärken.
TEXT.Italian: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.
TEXT.Spanish: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.

TEXT.English: Privateers will be mercilessly hunted.
TEXT.French: На каперов начнут безжалостную охоту.
TEXT.German: Freibeuter werden gnadenlos gejagt.
TEXT.Italian: Privateers will be mercilessly hunted.
TEXT.Spanish: Privateers will be mercilessly hunted.

TEXT.English: Mylord, one of our new privateers has been taken by the marine of our neighbours. The buccaneers have been hanged without mercy.
TEXT.French: Милорд, один из наших новых каперов был захвачен флотом нашего соседа. Весь экипаж был повешен...
TEXT.German: Mylord, der Freibeuter, den wir kürzlich mit einem neuen Kaperbrief ausstatteten, wurde von der Marine unserer Konkurenten aufgebracht und die Freibeuter wegen Piraterie gehängt.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, one of our new privateers has been taken by the marine of our neighbours. The buccaneers have been hanged without mercy.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, one of our new privateers has been taken by the marine of our neighbours. The buccaneers have been hanged without mercy.

TEXT.English: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.
TEXT.French: Жаль, но мы не можем это изменить. Нельзя отрицать, что они совершили несколько прибыльных рейдов.
TEXT.German: Tja, leider nicht zu ändern. Wenigstens konnten sie einige profitable Kaperfahrten durchführen.
TEXT.Italian: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.
TEXT.Spanish: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.

TEXT.English: A native from a tribe nearby wishes to join our colony.
TEXT.French: Индеец из соседнего племени желает присоединиться к нашей колонии.
TEXT.German: Ein Ureinwohner möchte sich euch schließen.

TEXT.English: Commander, a native wishes to settle down at our city. He fled from his tribe instead to fight againt their enemies, that means he is a coward.
TEXT.French: Милорд, напуганный туземец смиренно ждет в покоях вашей прислуги. Его племя отреклось от него, потому что он бежал вместо того, чтобы сражаться, когда конкистадоры совершили набег на его деревню. Он умоляет сжалиться над ним и дать шанс проявить себя.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein eingeschüchterter Indianer steht demütig in Eurer Gesindestube. Sein Stamm habe ihn verstoßen, weil er bei einem Überfall von Conquistadores auf sein Dorf geflohen war, statt zu kämpfen. Er bittet um Eure Gnade und eine neue Chance.

TEXT.English: Okay, give hin a bible.
TEXT.French: Дайте ему какую-нибудь работу.
TEXT.German: Dies sei ihm gewährt. Weist ihm eine Arbeit zu.

TEXT.English: No, catch him and sell him to the tribe. This will strengthen our relationship with the natives.
TEXT.French: Нет, поймайте его и продайте племени. Это укрепит наши отношения с туземцами.
TEXT.German: Nehmt ihn gefangen und verkauft ihn an den Stamm, das wird unsere Beziehungen auf lange Sicht stärken.

TEXT.English: You get a converted native.
TEXT.French: Крещённый индеец присоединяется к нашей колонии.
TEXT.German: Ein Konvertierter Ureinwohner schließt sich Euch an.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, в настоящее время известный миссионер путешествует по нашим колониям. Его слуга-туземец хочет его покинуть. Ему надоели непристойные ухаживания хозяина.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein Missionar reist derzeit durch unsere Kolonien. Sein indianischer Diener, der ihn begleitet, will ihn verlassen, weil er die unsittlichen Annäherungen seines Herrn satt hat.

TEXT.English: Okay.
TEXT.French: Под христианской благотворительностью я понимаю другое. Конечно, мы дадим прибежище индейцу.
TEXT.German: Unter christlicher Nächstenliebe verstehe ich etwas anderes. Selbstverständlich gewähren wir dem Indianer Zuflucht.

TEXT.English: You get a converted native.
TEXT.French: Крещённый индеец присоединяется к нам.
TEXT.German: Ein Konvertierter Ureinwohner schließt sich Euch an.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, приходской священник спрашивает, можете ли вы позаботиться о мальчике-туземце. Он потерял отца и мать из-за оспы и теперь совсем один.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, der Gemeindepfarrer fragt, ob ihr Euch eines Indianerjünglings annehmen könnt. Er habe Vater und Mutter durch die Blattern verloren und stehe jetzt ganz alleine da.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, индеец был пойман при попытке украсть серебряную чашу из церкви. Негодяй раскаивается и желает оплатить свой долг активным покаянием.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein Indianer wurde in Eurem Gotteshaus bei dem Versuch erwischt, den silbernen Messkelch zu stehlen. Die Rothaut ist reuig und möchte ihre Schuld durch tätige Buße begleichen.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, в исповедальне приходской священник убедил индейца в том, что его дикая природа неугодна Богу и может быть обуздана только упорным трудом под вашим строгим руководством.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, der Gemeindepfarrer konnte im Beichtstuhl eine Rothaut davon überzeugen, dass seine halbwilde Natur nicht gottgefällig ist und nur durch harte Arbeit unter Eurem strengen Kommando gezügelt werden könne.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, туземец, проходивший мимо церкви вдохновился её витражами. Он говорит, что утренний свет проник сквозь них прямо в его душу. Теперь он хочет среди нас.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein vorbeiziehender Indianer hat der Anblick der bunten Glasfenster in Eurem Gotteshaus bezaubert. Er sah das Morgenlicht durch sie hindurch in seine Seele leuchten, meint er. Nun möchte er unter uns Weißen leben.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, индейцу во время нашей церковной службы было видение. Он увидел Спасителя, стоящего у алтаря с пламенным мечом в правой руке и с отрубленной головой волка в левой руке. Теперь этот туземец хочет присоединиться к нашей борьбе со злом.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein Indianer erlebte beim zufälligen Besuch unseres Gottesdienstes eine Vision. Er sah den Heiland mit einem Flammenschwerte am Altar stehen, in der Linken trug er den abgeschlagenen Kopf eines Wolfes. Ehrfürchtig möchte sich die Rothaut nun unserem Kampfe anschließen.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, молодой индеец просит вас научить его читать, чтобы он мог изучать Священное Писание. Взамен он предлагает свою помощь везде, где будет потребность.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein junger Indianer bittet Euch, ihm das Lesen beizubringen, damit er in unserem Gotteshaus die Heilige Schrift studieren kann. Im Gegenzug bietet er an, überall anzupacken, wo Not am Mann ist.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, туземец готов отказаться от Маниту и вместо этого служить Господу нашему Иисусу Христу.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, eine Rothaut möchte Manitou abschwören und stattdessen unserem Herrn Jesus Christus dienen.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, местный юноша влюбился в статую Пресвятой Девы Марии, которая находится в нашем храме. Он теперь хочет жить в нашем приходе, чтобы всегда быть рядом с ней.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein Indianerjüngling hat sich in die Statue der Heiligen Jungfrau Maria verliebt, die in unserem Gotteshaus steht. Er möchte nun in unserer Gemeinde leben, um stets in ihrer Nähe zu sein.

TEXT.English: Commander, a converted native has visited our Lord's house. He is very impressed by our faith in God and wishes to settle down at our city.
TEXT.French: Милорд, мы поймали молодого туземца, который пробрался в подвал нашей церкви и выпил целый бочонок вина для причастия. Мальчик раскаивается и хочет отдать свой долг служением.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, wir haben eine Rothaut erwischt, die in den Keller unseres Gotteshauses eingebrochen und ein ganzes Fässchen unseres Messweines ausgesoffen hat. Der Bursche ist reuig und will seine Schuld durch Dienste abtragen.

TEXT.English: Okay.
TEXT.French: Мы позаботимся о нем.
TEXT.German: Wir werden uns um ihn kümmern.

TEXT.English: A forest fire sparked by lightning has raged across the land near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] бушует лесной пожар, вызванный ударом молнии.
TEXT.German: Viele Bürger von %s2_city verlieren bei den Bränden ihr Hab und Gut. Die Menschen sind empört.
TEXT.Italian: Un incendio forestale, causato da un fulmine, ha devastato il territorio vicino a %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Un incendio forestal causado por un rayo ha asolado las tierras aledañas a %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Playing children from %s2_city sparked a fire in the nearby forest and went home without stamping out the fire. Many acres of forest are burnt-down due to these brats!
TEXT.French: Милорд, молодой человек из [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] и его возлюбленная хотят пожениться, но их отцы - соперничающие угольщики, которые ненавидят друг друга. Упрямые старикашки отказываются дать свое благословение. Теперь отчаявшаяся парочка, шантажируя стариков, угрожает поджечь лес. Наши горожане знают, что лесной пожар может опустошить всю местность в округе. Они просят вас вмешаться.
TEXT.German: Kommandant, ein Bursche aus %s2_city und seine Maid wollen heiraten, doch sind ihre Väter zwei rivalisierende Köhler und einander spinnefeind. Die störrischen Waldschraten wollen den Beiden nicht ihren Segen geben. Nun hat sich das verzweifelte Pärchen im Forst versteckt und droht, ein Feuer zu legen, um die Alten zu erpressen. Die Bürger fürchten, ein Waldbrand könne die ganze Gegend verwüsten, und bitten Euch einzugreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Tragedia nei pressi di %s2_city: è scoppiato un incendio in un villaggio e si è propagato alla vicina foresta, devastando il territorio per chilometri.
TEXT.Spanish: La tragedia se ha cebado con %s2_city, pues un incendio en la aldea se ha propagado al bosque, y ha chamuscado una gran superficie de tierra.

TEXT.English: Organize a replanting effort.
TEXT.French: Организуйте пересадку.
TEXT.German: Schickt den Köhlern je einen Batzen Gold und mein Versprechen, den Liebenden das Hochzeitsbankett zu spendieren. Mammon macht missvergnügte Männer mürbe.
TEXT.Italian: Organizza un rimboschimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Que empiecen las tareas de repoblación forestal.

TEXT.English: We are too pressed to spare any aid.
TEXT.French: У нас недостаточно денег, чтобы предложить свою помощь.
TEXT.German: Wie heißt diese Posse - "Romeo und Julia für Hinterwändler"? Die sollen ihre Streitigkeiten selber regeln.
TEXT.Italian: Siamo troppo sotto pressione per inviare aiuti.
TEXT.Spanish: Estamos demasiado apurados como para prestarles ayuda.

TEXT.English: A forest fire sparked by lightning has raged across the land near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Возле [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] бушует лесной пожар, вызванный ударом молнии.
TEXT.German: Viele Bürger von %s2_city verlieren bei den Bränden ihr Hab und Gut. Die Menschen sind empört.
TEXT.Italian: Un incendio forestale, causato da un fulmine, ha devastato il territorio vicino a %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Un incendio forestal causado por un rayo ha asolado las tierras aledañas a %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Playing children from %s2_city sparked a fire in the nearby forest and went home without stamping out the fire. Many acres of forest are burnt-down due to these brats!
TEXT.French: В городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] пара шутников рассказала деревенскому идиоту, что в ближайшем лесу поселился оборотень, который будет на него охотится. И дурачок не придумал ничего лучше, как поджечь лес, чтобы уничтожить нечисть. Восточный ветер раздувает пламя, разгоняя по земле стену огня и превращая бесчисленные акры в пепел.
TEXT.German: In %s2_city haben ein paar übermütige Burschen dem Dorfnarren eingeredet, durch den nahen Forst streife ein Werwolf, der es auf ihn höchstpersönlich abgesehen habe. Daraufhin hat der verängstigte Tölpel im Wald ein Feuer gelegt, um die Bestie zu verbrennen. Der Ostwind hat die Flammen entfacht, und eine Feuerwalze rast durch das Land. Die Todeshitze droht viele Hektar in rußige Asche zu verwandeln.
TEXT.Italian: Tragedia nei pressi di %s2_city: è scoppiato un incendio in un villaggio e si è propagato alla vicina foresta, devastando il territorio per chilometri.
TEXT.Spanish: La tragedia se ha cebado con %s2_city, pues un incendio en la aldea se ha propagado al bosque, y ha chamuscado una gran superficie de tierra.

TEXT.English: Organize a replanting effort.
TEXT.French: Организуйте пересадку.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet so viele helfende Hände wie Ihr findet, um die Feuersbrunst zu löschen.
TEXT.Italian: Organizza un rimboschimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Que empiecen las tareas de repoblación forestal.

TEXT.English: We are too pressed to spare any aid.
TEXT.French: У нас недостаточно денег, чтобы предложить свою помощь.
TEXT.German: Schlimme Kunde. Schnell! Spurt euch! Ich brauche sofort einen Schnaps gegen den Schrecken.
TEXT.Italian: Siamo troppo sotto pressione per inviare aiuti.
TEXT.Spanish: Estamos demasiado apurados como para prestarles ayuda.

TEXT.English: The word is that in %s2_city a lazy Admial eats the governor out of house and home.
TEXT.French: Ходят слухи, что в городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] распутный адмирал своими запоями довел местного мэра до приступов мигрени.
TEXT.German: Man munkelt, dass ein untätiger Admiral durch seine Gelage in %s2_city dem örtlichen Statthalter die Haare vom Kompf frisst.
TEXT.Italian: The word is that in %s2_city a lazy Admial eats the governor out of house and home.
TEXT.Spanish: The word is that in %s2_city a lazy Admial eats the governor out of house and home.

TEXT.English: Mylord, the new Admiral who arrived recently eats and drinks more than we can tolerate and spents more time with women than with the new recruits. His banquets are common talk. We have to do something to stop it.
TEXT.French: Милорд, новый адмирал только и делает, что ест и пьет и проводит с женщинами больше времени, чем с новобранцами. О его банкетах судачат уже по всему городу. Мы должны что-то предпринять, чтобы остановить это.
TEXT.German: Mylord, einer unserer neu bestallten Admiräle feiert lieber und labt sich an Wein und Frauen, als dass er unseren jungen Matrosen Seemannschaft beibringt. Seine Gelage sind schon Stadtgespräch. Wir müssen etwas unternehmen, so etwas ist schlecht für die Moral.
TEXT.Italian: Mylord, the new Admiral who arrived recently eats and drinks more than we can tolerate and spents more time with women than with the new recruits. His banquets are common talk. We have to do something to stop it.
TEXT.Spanish: Mylord, the new Admiral who arrived recently eats and drinks more than we can tolerate and spents more time with women than with the new recruits. His banquets are common talk. We have to do something to stop it.

TEXT.English: Ah, what the heck! He was at sea for a such a long time. He needs to enjoy his time onshore. Our storage is absolutely full. However, we need to keep an eye on him.
TEXT.French: Ах, этот человек так долго был в море. Понятно, что ему нужно немного выпустить пар. Пусть повеселится - наши хранилища до отказа забиты продуктами. Но мы будем следить за ним.
TEXT.German: Ach was, der Mann war lange auf See. Ist doch verständlich, dass er sich ein wenig austoben muss. Lasst ihm den Spaß. Unsere Speicher sind doch prall gefüllt. Aber wir behalten ihn im Auge.
TEXT.Italian: Ah, what the heck! He was at sea for a such a long time. He needs to enjoy his time onshore. Our storage is absolutely full. However, we need to keep an eye on him.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, what the heck! He was at sea for a such a long time. He needs to enjoy his time onshore. Our storage is absolutely full. However, we need to keep an eye on him.

TEXT.English: Ah, what the heck! If he drills his recruits with the same dedication I'm fine with it. He is a tough guy. I'll pay his bill.
TEXT.French: Если в будущем он будет обучать молодых матросов с таким же рвением, с каким сейчас поглощает вино, то я не против. И я лично оплачу его счет. Только подумайте, как это будет полезно для нашего молодого флота!
TEXT.German: Wenn er hinterher die jungen Matrosen mit der gleichen Hingabe ausbildet, wie er jetzt dem Wein zuspricht, soll's mir recht sein. Ich werde seine Rechnung persönlich begleichen. Bedenkt, was er für unsere junge Marine für einen Nutzen hat!
TEXT.Italian: Ah, what the heck! If he drills his recruits with the same dedication I'm fine with it. He is a tough guy. I'll pay his bill.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, what the heck! If he drills his recruits with the same dedication I'm fine with it. He is a tough guy. I'll pay his bill.

TEXT.English: Absolutely correct. We will give him a ship. Sea air is the best way to deal with a binge and he can prove his good seamanship. We have a sloop in port. He will take command of this sloop. Issue the sailing order!
TEXT.French: Мы дадим ему корабль. Морской воздух — лучший способ справиться с запоем и он может показать свои морские навыки. У нас есть шлюп в порту. Пусть берёт на себя командование этим кораблём. Отдайте приказ на отплытие!
TEXT.German: Ihr habt vollkommen recht, so geht es nicht weiter. Wir werden ihm ein Schiff geben. Seeluft ist das beste Mittel gegen Säuferei. Da kann er mal zeigen, dass er noch nicht all seine Seemannschaft versoffen hat. Es liegt doch eine Sloop im Hafen. Die kann er nehmen. Fertigt nur gleich die Segelorder aus!
TEXT.Italian: Absolutely correct. We will give him a ship. Sea air is the best way to deal with a binge and he can prove his good seamanship. We have a sloop in port. He will take command of this sloop. Issue the sailing order!
TEXT.Spanish: Absolutely correct. We will give him a ship. Sea air is the best way to deal with a binge and he can prove his good seamanship. We have a sloop in port. He will take command of this sloop. Issue the sailing order!

TEXT.English: In %s2_city the navy equips a sloop. It seems that the Admiral will get his sailing order soon.
TEXT.French: В городе [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] военно-морской флот снарядил для экспедиции новый шлюп. Похоже, адмирал скоро получит приказ о выходе в море.
TEXT.German: In %s2_city rüstet die Marine eine neue Sloop aus. Der Admiral wird wohl bald seine Segelorder erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: In %s2_city the navy equips a sloop. It seems that the Admiral will get his sailing order soon.
TEXT.Spanish: In %s2_city the navy equips a sloop. It seems that the Admiral will get his sailing order soon.

TEXT.English: But it seems that the governor in %s2_city is a generous man.
TEXT.French: Но похоже, что мэр города [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]%s2_city[COLOR_REVERT] великодушный человек.
TEXT.German: Aber der Statthalter in %s2_city ist offenbar ein großzügiger Mann.
TEXT.Italian: But it seems that the governor in %s2_city is a generous man.
TEXT.Spanish: But it seems that the governor in %s2_city is a generous man.
